## [Chapter 1: Forsaken City](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1:_Forsaken_City)\[\]

### A-Side (1A)\[\]

1A's very low difficulty makes it very easy to obtain the Golden Strawberry for the level as long as the player is not reckless, as the level is short and without many difficult sections.

Completing 1A without dashing will allow the player to collect the Winged Golden Strawberry. The Winged Golden Strawberry is unique because unlike other golden berries, the player does not have to worry about dying and it can be obtained before beating 8B.

### B-Side (1B)\[\]

1B is a much harder level than 1A. To obtain the Golden Berry, the player must have a decent understanding of how momentum works in this game, often requiring them to grab the traffic light blocks in a specific way to pass an obstacle. In addition, many rooms require the player to manage their stamina properly.

In the stamina management rooms, it is recommended to learn how to neutral jump, performed by tapping the jump button on a wall with no directional input, as this does not consume stamina. Knowing this trick will help reduce the risk of running out of stamina.

### C-Side (1C)\[\]

1C is usually considered the easiest or second easiest C-Side to beat with a Golden Strawberry, as the level's gameplay is relatively straightforward.

In the first room, dashing upwards into the crystals is the easiest and least risky way to get through the traffic light blocks.

In the second room, it is recommended to grab the first vertical traffic light block in the middle and the second one in the top or bottom. If the player is comfortable with advanced movement, they can wavedash or extended hyper to the first falling block, grab the second one, and do another wavedash on the final falling block, which allows the vertical traffic light blocks in the middle of the room to be skipped.

## [Chapter 2: Old Site](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_2:_Old_Site)\[\]

### A-Side (2A)\[\]

2A is a slightly harder level than 1A, though one minor skip to note does exist and cuts off some of the challenges. The final vertical room of the Badeline chase sequence has multiple quicker strategies. The most notable skip in the final room is a noticeable platform at the beginning that hangs from a wall near some spikes, which leads to a narrow passage that must be dashed through to reach.

Madeline standing at the location which the skip can be done

### B-Side (2B)\[\]

2B's Golden Strawberry is generally considered to be either easier or about as difficult as the one in 1B (especially easier if the player is comfortable with space block jumps).

The majority of difficult rooms involve Badeline chase segments, so it is recommended to find a safe strategy for these rooms. In addition, some rooms can be made easier with space block re-grabs (done by holding grab and the opposite direction in which the player initially dashed).

In the first room of the final subchapter, there's no need to jump off of the space block as the player can grab the side of it to make moving around easier. It will still be required later in this section though. Once the player goes to the cassette room, they can take their time as it is impossible to die.

### C-Side (2C)\[\]

2C's Golden Strawberry is generally tied with 1C's Golden Strawberry in terms of difficulty. The main challenge is mostly about learning the final room, as it is the only one that will likely be challenging for a player. In the last room, there are a few spots in which the player can grab the side of a space block to align themself for a dash. However, most of the space blocks near the end of the room will require space block jumps, so patience is not a possibility. The player should dash directly into the heart immediately after leaving the last space block so that they are not pushed into the spikes by the heart.

## [Chapter 3: Celestial Resort](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort)\[\]

### A-Side (3A)\[\]

3A's most difficult subchapters are the second, [Huge Mess](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Huge_Mess) and the fourth, [Presidential Suite](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Presidential_Suite).

In Huge Mess, try to find a room order that suits you the most (example: middle - bottom - top). The less clutter there is in a section, the harder is it to pass them. Try to start with the section you find the most troublesome, and then go with the easier ones. It may be easiest to do the section with the room you find hardest first.

In [Elevator Shaft](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Elevator_Shaft), the player may attempt to skip the subchapter's key by performing a demodash. However, this is a risky strategy. In the room with the key, the player will want to dash to the sinking platforms when the moving sludges move to the left.

In Presidential Suite, it's better to take it slow. Rushing and being impatient often results with the player dying in this level. In the part with a row of dash crystals over the dust bunnies, the best strategy is to wait until Oshiro is about to charge at you, and then jump over him and keep dashing. Doing this section like that gives you enough time to take it slow.

### B-Side (3B)\[\]

While it may look scary at first, 3B is surprisingly very well designed around the cycles. 3B's difficulty mainly derives from its first two subchapters. Many of 3B's screens can be completed in different ways, depending on your timing. It's recommended to keep that in mind to find alternative strategies for certain rooms. Learning how to neutral jump or bounce off of walls without grabbing them helps a lot with managing stamina in many rooms.

Apart from the room with key tokens, the [Start (Celestial Resort B-Side)](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Celestial_Resort_B-Side)) is rather straightforward. The best way is to keep it slow and pay attention to the cycles. You can hang on the top corners of the bottom platforms without getting hit by the moving sludge. That way you can wait until the spring is close to you, allowing you to regain your dash and stamina.

The second subchapter may be the hardest one to learn. In the second room, prepare to jump off of the left walls when the moving sludges are about to move to the right. You can grab the top block as a safe spot. Do the same with the rest of the walls to proceed. The laundry room can be tricky to learn, but it gets very consistent if you get the muscle memory down. In the first laundry room (the one with blue walls), you can wall bounce off of the top right wall to grab the crystal and grab the overhang. It's a good safe spot to land on the purple platform below you. The third laundry section can also be started with a wall bounce to save some stamina. Moving sludges have a longer delay before they move, which is something you have to get used to when practicing.

The third room is mostly about muscle memory due to awkward timings in some spots. In the second room, you can keep jumping off of the left wall to time your dash between the moving sludges. If done properly, they will move in the middle of your jump, allowing you to dash between them and jumping off of the right wall. This strategy may be a bit risky at first, but it saves a lot of stamina. The second to last section of this subchapter looks very stressful, however it's actually really simple. Jump in between them when they move up, then perform a diagonal downwards dash when they're about to move down. If you understand the timing, this part becomes very simple. The last section can be done by just dashing from spring to spring. Depending on your timing, the cycles may be different, so try to find an alternative strategy just in case if the cycle won't be in your favor.

In the first Oshiro room, it's recommended to jump on him or climb up when he's about to charge, allowing you to regain your dash and stamina by bouncing off of his head, which can be very helpful at the end of the room. The fourth room can be tricky, however if you perform an extended super at the beginning, you will keep an extra dash while you'll still be collecting the dash crystals, giving you a secondary boost if Oshiro is about to attack you. This allows you to dodge him or the dust bunnies in a very consistent pattern. In the last room, don't waste your dashes, as using them in a wrong spot will most likely end up with dying to the sludge-spawning tiles. The cassette room is pretty straightforward, however try to take it slow to avoid dying on it. The wall on the bottom can be grabbed from different sides and the springs can help you grabbing many Shields at once.

### C-Side (3C)\[\]

3C is often considered one of the harder C-Sides for many players. However, most of this level is muscle memory. In the first section, the player needs to jump when the moving sludges are about to move, and then keep dashing diagonally upwards as soon as they grab the dash crystals. It often takes a while to get the rhythm, but once learned, it becomes consistent.

The third room requires at least one Oshiro bounce at the very end. Use the lightning effect as a visual cue to understand when it's best to jump. He attacks right after the animation ends, so try to jump when it's about to end and you should be able to land on his head easily. Once you get to the gate at the end, you can grab on its side and start moving up when Oshiro is about to charge. It should end with him landing right under Madeline, causing you to bounce off of him. This can be used to regain your dash in an easier way at the very end.

## [Chapter 4: Golden Ridge](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_4:_Golden_Ridge)\[\]

### A-Side (4A)\[\]

A good portion of this chapter is just getting used to the wind physics. You can use tricks such as hyperdashes to speed it up, however try to use them only when you're feeling comfortable with it. Triggered platform and guided platform rooms are also worth practicing.

The snowball section may be tricky for players, as they can easily get hit if careless. Try to take it slow and dash only when you have enough time to move away from the obstacle. If you are close to the right side of the screen, try to wait until the snowball appears and then quickly dash to the right to avoid getting hit by it instantly.

### B-Side (4B)\[\]

The B-Side requires the player to fight with the wind, while performing some tricky jumps, and memorizing patterns for several triggered platform and guided platform rooms that may be difficult. In guided platform rooms, keep in mind that the blocks don't have to fit perfectly into the gaps. If they're less than a block off, they should still fit into the tunnel. Because the rest is rather straightforward to learn, this one mostly relies on getting consistently good at these rooms.

The first difficult triggered platform room can be found in the middle of the second subchapter, [Stepping Stones](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Stepping_Stones). It's recommended to use as little stamina here as possible. After using the spring, try to jump on the platform so you grab the top of it, then try jumping on the other side without the need to climb back up. There's a significant bit of room for error in this one, but it's recommended to find a strategy without using much stamina. If you happen to start losing stamina while you're about to go to the end, you can quickly climb up and use the platform's momentum when jumping to get enough distance for the last dash crystal.

The second one can be found in the middle of [Gusty Canyon](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Gusty_Canyon), with three small triggered platforms moving to the right. Activate the first two so that they're very close in line, and then grab the last one as soon as possible and drop on the bottom one when there's enough space. Stay on it and wait until you get to the pillar of crystals. Jump, dash over the crystals and if done properly, you should be able to land on the middle triggered platform. Remember to crouch in order to not hit the ceiling made out of crystals.

After that, a guided platform room can be reached, which is not too difficult as long as you remember to keep going quickly. As said before, the platform doesn't need to fit perfectly into the gaps, so try to not spend too much time aligning it and instead hop on the clouds as soon as possible and grab the triggered platform at the very top to get it out of the way. If you don't reach it in time and the guided platform disintegrates, you can also make it back down to the start with some simple maneuvering, which can be very helpful during a Golden Strawberry attempt.

The ending is a place where people may often die if they mess up the last jump. Wait until the blocks turn to pink, then slowly walk off the very edge of the platform as the blocks change to blue and dash right into the Crystal Heart.

### C-Side (4C)\[\]

The main problem with this section is the second room. The player must be fast, and it's best to save your stamina when needed by not using the grab button while wall jumping. The last room is mostly straightforward but it's recommended to practice the cloud jumps. Try to dash a bit away from the cloud as the wind is pretty strong and you might miss it easily.

## [Chapter 5: Mirror Temple](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_5:_Mirror_Temple)\[\]

### A-Side (5A)\[\]

This chapter is fairly long in a casual run but there are several skips that can make it a lot quicker when doing a Golden Strawberry run. The first one can be found in one of the rooms in the [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Mirror_Temple)) subchapter. When the player stays on the right side of the swap block while it's at the very bottom, they can perform a reversed hyperdash followed by a regular straight dash to skip straight past the corridor of crystals and reach the key room which saves a little bit of time. If you're not comfortable with this technique, it is certainly not a necessity to learn as the time save is not too major.

The next skip can be found close to the end of the second subchapter, [Depths](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Depths). The player can use the key door skip that's normally required to get the Crystal Heart. Because of that, there's no need to look out for the key which saves some time.

The last skip, called Search Skip, can be found at the beginning of [Search](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Search). When the player gets to the platforms with keys under them, they can skip most of this subchapter with a specific technique. In order to do it, stay on the left side of the platform to the left and perform a reverse super extended diagonally upwards. It's recommended to practice the timing in order to be capable of performing this trick with replenishing your dash as well. If you don't regain your dash, it means you're doing it too early.

The rest of the level is pretty much the same, but it's recommended to play through [Rescue](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Rescue) a few times to avoid getting killed by Seekers. If you throw the crystal against a wall and dash upwards into it, you can reach some higher ground if timed properly. If you dash horizontally into the crystal, you gain more momentum for a short amount of time, allowing yourself to escape situations such as being chased by a Seeker. Try to not rely 100% on one strategy and always have a plan B just in case, as Seekers may be a bit unpredictable at times. If you go to a certain spot slightly too quick or too slow, they may move in a completely different place. Keep that in mind to avoid surprise deaths.

### B-Side (5B)\[\]

In the second subchapter, the player can save time by only grabbing one of the keys (the right one is easier but slower, the left one is more difficult but quicker), which allows the player to save time by performing a spike jump (avoiding the key needed for the intended strategy). Although this saves a fair amount of time, it is risky and should be avoided for less experienced players.

In the final room of the third subchapter, [Through the Mirror](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Through_the_Mirror), a reliable route is to immediately do three supers in a row from the right-hand edge of the initial platform, followed by a brief hesitation before an ordinary jump into the gap. The Seeker will reliably stop within reach. Alternatively, the player can avoid the Seeker entirely by performing an ultra with the final two platforms on the left side, giving enough distance to make it to the rightmost platform. An extended hyperdash from the last platform on the lower right, followed by a dash to grab the side of the platform, also clears the gap. Refer to the subchapter's main page for more specific details on timings.

### C-Side (5C)\[\]

5C's Golden Strawberry requires the use of many wall bounces, so it may be in the player's best interest to become comfortable with the mechanic. There's not much to this level except just learning how to time specific dashes or bounces.

In the first room, the player may opt to perform a wavedash (or extended hyper) on the starting platform to skip the first wall bounce of the room.

In the second room, a consistent strategy is for the player to align themselves with the center of the swap block's path, which will prevent them from missing the correct timing for the wall bounce.

At the beginning of the third room, you can use the bottom route to get to the bubbles without much trouble.

## [Chapter 6: Reflection](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_6:_Reflection)\[\]

### A-Side (6A)\[\]

6A's Golden Strawberry is located in the second subchapter, [Lake](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Lake). This means that the player can skip the first subchapter, [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Reflection)), and go straight to the second subchapter using the menu.

The beginning of Chapter 6 is rather straightforward and doesn't require much practice because the player has a lot of room for error to deal with. In the beginning of [Hollows](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Hollows), there's an alternate way to get to the top by doing neutral jumps off of the left wall and then jumping and dashing to the right when at the top of the wall. It's not necessarily faster nor practical, but if a player is comfortable with neutral jumping and afraid of getting crushed by the angry platform, they can use this alternative way.

The main difficulty of this chapter is the boss fight. Some of the first rooms can be done easily by trying to hit Badeline as soon as possible. In some of the later screens, it's better to take it slow as she can easily catch you off guard. In the feather rooms, try to wait until she shoots the laser and jump and start flying right away. That way you will have enough time to run away from the attack, and if needed, you can dash away from the feather to a safe spot to avoid getting hit. In the long vertical rooms, you can hit Badeline several times by dashing into her from mid-air. It's recommended to hit her as soon as possible in these sections.

The second phase is generally easier due to it being shorter and giving the player enough time to react. In two sections you have to use a block to momentum jump into her. To perform that, start moving and jump when the block is about to stop, to gain maximum distance. The final room can be easy to mess up, so be sure to learn the timings in it. Similar to the previous rooms, jump into the feather as soon as the laser is gone and fly towards the next safe spot. When you get to the split paths, take the bottom route. It's less risky and it gives you enough time to move away from the beam with this strategy. After that, take your time to perform the next few jumps and pay attention to the laser. Once you get to the cutscene, the berry will be yours.

As a general tip, don't rush in the laser sections if you aren't confident enough. The indicator moves for a few seconds and then stops for a second, allowing you to jump or grab a block out of its way. Use this to dodge the attacks.

### B-Side (6B)\[\]

Though mostly considered fun to complete conventionally, most players quickly realize that this level can be rather frustrating to get the golden strawberry for. It is very difficult to be consistent with quick and precise movements from the feathers, many bumpers which call for specific angling, and a Badeline AI that can change with any slight variations in the player's strategy. It is important to just get a feel for it through practice to minimize the inconsistencies.

In the sixth room of the [\|Reflection](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Reflection_(B-Side)) subchapter, the need for the angry platform can be removed entirely with an extended hyperdash, saving the dash that needed to be regained using the aforementioned block. However, this does not save much time.

The ninth room of the same subchapter requires a lot of precision near the end, it is one of the levels where the strategy is clear but it just requires a lot of practice, though it is important to pay attention to those last two holes. If to the left of the second to last hole, just do a dash; if to the right, then positioning must be corrected towards the left after the dash. That difference makes the last segment feel very inconsistent.

The second room of the [Rock Bottom](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Rock_Bottom_(B-Side)) subchapter can be made easier by remembering to dash upwards to reach the first falling block and right to reach the second, grabbing onto the left side and jumping over the top at the appropriate time is easier than trying to avoid them entirely.

In the third room of the subchapter, after the first time Badeline has been touched, the following laser can be dodged by jumping off the falling platform early so she aims it high giving enough time to clear the gauntlet and touch her again before the next laser.

In the fourth room, it can be tricky near the end of the second use of the second feather, though cutting as much corners in the path as possible can buy time to navigate over the crystals, to the switch and to the third Badeline touch.

In the fifth room, extended hyperdashing off of the disappearing platform at the end can saving having to use the final bumper which can be tricky with Badeline firing away.

In the second room of [Reprieve](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Reprieve), after touching Badeline for a second time, the moving wall can be ignored by bouncing on top of the bumper, then dashing into the bumper from the right and dashing up-right over it to Badeline.

In the fourth room of this subchapter, it is useful to try and bait out Badeline's laser at a safe space before running through each gauntlet whenever possible when entering the room or when grabbing on the side of a wall.

The last room before the rhythm block room that contains the heart is very hard to complete consistently, fortunately it is the room with the least need for consistency as the relatively easy rhythm block room is the only challenge that lies after it. Retry this room many times until you get comfortable with all of the timing necessary, but remember that the timings on respawns will not be the same as the ones on first entrance which will be what you must follow in your actual Golden Strawberry attempt.

### C-Side (6C)\[\]

The C-Side is rather straightforward, however it's recommended to practice the ending and try to beat it a few times. Some of the bumpers are easy to miss, especially the very last one that can easily lead to a devastating death next to the heart. In some situations it's more safe to dash into a bumper, as hitting it will replenish your dash anyway, and that way you will be more sure that you will not miss it.

## [Chapter 7: The Summit](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_7:_The_Summit)\[\]

### A-Side (7A)\[\]

This is the longest level in the game aside from [Chapter 9: Farewell](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_9:_Farewell), meaning that deaths will be very costly especially later on. Knowledge on all of the subchapters will be crucial to ensure that the least time possible is wasted.

#### [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(The_Summit))\[\]

This has rather straightforward platforming and is the easiest part of the level. In the room with a few vertical thin walls, you can skip some of them by dashing under them, making this section a little faster. Apart from that there isn't much difference than the casual run.

#### [500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/500_M)\[\]

This one is also pretty straightforward. As long as you're comfortable with momentum, it shouldn't be too bad. In the section with key tokens, you can grab on the walls and feel free to use springs to replenish your dashes.

#### [1000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1000_M)\[\]

One of the easiest sections if the player is taking it slowly. If you are rushing it too much, you may risk wasting your dash by accident, not getting enough distance to dash through a space block. Although it's not needed in the game, jumping out of them may make certain actions easier and it can save up a dash for later. In the section with key tokens, a good order is: left, bottom, top, right. After getting the last one to the right, you can use the spring to get your dashes back.

#### [1500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1500_M)\[\]

This is generally considered to be the second hardest subchapter. Due to the cycles, this one requires some patience to avoid falling into a dust bunny or other obstacle.

In the section with the four moving sludges and one key token in the middle, use the bottom moving sludge as a visual cue. Stay on the line between the bottom blocks, wait until the moving sludge at the bottom goes to the up-left and then goes back to the bottom-right. Be prepared so right after it goes to the bottom-right, do a diagonal dash to the key token and after a somewhat short delay, perform another diagonal dash. It may be tricky to do at first, but with enough practice it becomes very simple.

The next section with key tokens is more open. However, if you're careless, you might dash right into a moving sludge. A good strategy is to do a well-spaced diagonal dash followed by a straight dash to the right. If by any means the moving sludge gets in your way, you can dash diagonally, wait for a split second and perform another diagonal dash to the right.

The last tricky section is at the end. There's some leeway with blocks on which you can stand on if you get a bad pattern or don't want to risk dying. Keep in mind that you can stand on them only once, so either don't walk on the entire platform or dash above/below the moving sludge from the air when going from one direction.

#### [2000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2000_M)\[\]

This is another straightforward checkpoint, however there are two spots that may kill a player. In the first room with wind, there's a spring on the wall that bounces you towards a small floating platform with a spike on top. You have to dash once after getting bounced by the spring and then let yourself get pushed to the left by the wind, however don't do it immediately or you might fly right into the spike. The second tricky section has snowballs that can kill you if you’re careless. Don't mess around too much with tricks and take your time. After it the rest should be rather simple to do.

#### [2500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2500_M)\[\]

This is one of the easiest checkpoints if the player knows how swap blocks and their momentum work. Keep in mind that momentum can be cruel and if you are dashing from a swap block, always jump off of it or you might risk getting pushed off of your destination due to momentum. In the section with the key, you can slide on the left wall and wait until the obstacles move away. It's recommended to keep a dash for the last row of moving blades, as it will save you some struggle.

#### [3000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/3000_M)\[\]

The hardest part of the entire level lies towards the end. Most of it is rather easy to understand and straightforward, however it's recommended to do a few deathless runs of this checkpoints to gain consistency. Pay extra attention to difficult checkpoints such as 16, 14, 13, 11, 10, 9, and 3. They have some timings that are fairly tight for an A-Side and they may easily kill your run if you’re careless. Pay attention to the wind as it also affects your jumps. If the wind blows down, you jump slightly lower, fall faster, and can’t climb as high. If it's blowing up, Madeline is more floaty and jumps slightly higher.

### B-Side (7B)\[\]

7B is an extremely long chapter and is considered to be one of the most challenging Golden Strawberries as a result. However, most strategies are straightforward and much of the chapter's difficulty lies in precision. Unfortunately, there is not much to be said other than just practice to help with parts like 3000 M's dreaded checkpoint 13 or while timing bubble exits at 2500 M. Due to its sheer length it is heavily advised to do a lot of practice before ever picking up the golden strawberry, even then it is good to take breaks and go to individual rooms that have caused significant trouble.

The third room of the 500 M segment is one of the easiest rooms in the game when done correctly, extended hyperdashing off of the first platform will allow the player to just simply dash under then up the block with the first spring on it. Bear in mind the last three blocks with the spikes on top do not need to be grabbed as they too can just be dashed under then up.

In the third room of 1500 M the cycle can be navigated by leaving as the first moving sludge starts to move from its low position to its high position, from there immediately go to the bottom left switch and onto the spring board right next to it which should launch Madeline to meet the moving platform with a spring in the middle of its path, from there dash up onto the wall to the right of the circling sludge and jump for the top right switch when that moving sludge is just past its closest point to said switch. Go for the spring at the bottom left again which should send Madeline towards the bottom switch, follow that with two dashes upwards in order to land on the spring and head to the bottom right switch. Grab onto the wall and wait to bounce on the spring when it is moving towards Madeline AND the moving sludge is moving away. From there, dash upwards and grab onto the wall next to the final switch, waiting for the nearby moving sludge to move to its low point to jump for the switch and to the end.

The final room of 1500 M seems very difficult to do consistently. One strategy is to dash into the lower spring as the nearby moving sludge starts moving downwards, dash past the first two moving moving sludges at a steady pace, wait for the third moving sludge to move towards its high position before dashing past and dash past the fourth as it is sitting at its low position. Dash past the fifth moving sludge before it moves downwards in order to hit the spring and pass over it as it is moving down. At the last moving sludge, dash upwards before reaching it and follow with an up-left dash, grabbing onto the wall above the last spring, from there just wait until any appropriate time to drop onto the spring to avoid the moving sludge and dash up towards the end of the segment.

For the third room of [2000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2000_M_(B-Side)) it is important to note that Madeline can go up to the respawn point without the snowballs appearing. From that point, hyperdash and follow that with a right dash into the left side of the first pillar, climb up it and the first snowball should go under Madeline. Once the pillar has been climbed repeat the process, hyperdash off, dashing into the side and climbing up.

The strategy for the last room at [2500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2500_M_(B-Side)) is straightforward, however it can be easier to time the exit of the first red bubble by looking at the squid-like eldritch statue in the background and dashing out as the bubble covers its eye.

Checkpoint 17 of [3000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/3000_M_(B-Side)) can be skipped by jumping to the left followed by a up-left dash and an upwards dash in order to super wall jump off of the wall, this will send Madeline high enough and far enough left to be able to grab onto the edge at the base of checkpoint 16.

Checkpoint 4 can be made easier by wavedashing off the edge followed by two upwards dashes. Same can be said for the checkpoint 3, wavedashing left and dashing straight up can skip a dangerous wall bounce. This technique also helps skip to the first cloud of checkpoint 2.

### C-Side (7C)\[\]

The first section of the level is more forgiving that it looks. If you memorize how it looks and if you mess up a wall bounce, you can fall down and grab one of the ledges at the bottom and wait for the dash crystal to reappear. That way you can save yourself from death.

The last room is muscle memory. The beginning is the hardest part as it requires precise timings. Some springs require to be hit as high as possible to pass through tall walls of crystals. After playing through the room a couple of times and having it fresh in your memory, it should naturally be simpler to complete the room in a Golden Strawberry attempt.

## [Chapter 8: Core](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_8:_Core)\[\]

### A-Side (8A)\[\]

8A's Golden Strawberry is located in the second subchapter, [Into the Core](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Into_the_Core). This means that the player can skip the first subchapter, [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Core)), and go straight to the second subchapter using the menu.

A good portion of this chapter is memorizing how patterns work. Close to the beginning, there's a major skip known as Ice Skip. In order to perform it, go to the berry room to the left, come back to the room with fire balls on top and keep running, jump into the crystal, dash upwards and then do two diagonal dashes to the top. Keep in mind that the dashes need to be spaced out a bit in order to fit between the flames. Once learned, the strategy becomes very consistent.

Another room the player may struggle with is the room in [Hot and Cold](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Hot_and_Cold) which has columns of ice balls and bumpers around. Try to find a pattern there and don't rush it. Keep it slow and remember that you can bounce around from one row to another. There's a fair amount of dash crystals that will replenish your dash when needed. At the end of the section, it's best to jump from one row to another and flip the hot/cold switch to progress.

The last section is not particularly difficult, but it's best to memorize how everything works in them. Because of time pressure, a player may do a lot of mistakes. Despite the time limit, the player still has a decent amount of time to plan their jumps or other actions. In the cassette room, it's best to jump slowly from platform to platform. Keep your dashes for the fire parts and if you don't rush too much, you should be able to complete it fairly easily.

### B-Side (8B)\[\]

8B's Golden Strawberry is located in the second subchapter, [Into the Core](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Into_the_Core_(B-Side)). This means that the player can skip the first subchapter, [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Core_B-Side)), and go straight to the second subchapter using the menu.

8B's Golden Strawberry is regarded as the second- or third-most difficult golden in the game. It is very important to develop consistent strategies. Rooms with no or little cycles often show clear strategies and are often down to just skill. This chapter contains many cycles which can be more consistently bypassed with some of the techniques stated below.

The first room is very chaotic and initially looks daunting to learn. The following pattern will allow all fireballs to be dodged with proper fine tuning of jump height. Wait at the edge and do a short jump as soon as a fireball goes just high enough to jump under, this is to be shortly followed by a up-right dash, jumping immediately as Madeline lands on the next platform and dashing upwards when below the dash crystal, stay still and fall a dash's distance and follow that with a very quick up-right then right dash on to the next platform, follow that with a quick jump off to the right, collecting the dash crystal, dashing up right twice and quickly jumping over the last two platforms.

The fourth room can be very easily cleared with the correct timing, if the player starts moving as soon as they enter the room (alternatively they can jump off the solid ground the moment they see an ice ball rise from the spikes at the first column), after jumping off the solid ground and dashing up-right they can just jump across the ice balls, just holding left for the first crystal wall, halting at the second and fourth crystal walls in order to fall around half a dash's distance to keep holding right again and halting at the 3rd crystal wall to dash though it.

The room that marks the start of the [Burning or Freezing](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Burning_or_Freezing) subchapter can be the most difficult to learn due to challenges in grip management. It is advised to touch the launching block when the first fireball touches the bottom wall of crystals (the full cycle involves a full rotation of either of the first two fireballs). Using correct timing to navigate the first two fireballs will allow the final fireball to be accessed by waiting slightly before shooting up the conveyor wall and wall jumping off the protrusion below the fireballs path to the right then off of the left wall.

The third room of the subchapter can be fairly difficult to learn, though it can be cleared as quickly if the player immediately starts going through it right after entering at walking pace, take as few jumps as possible in order to avoid running out of ice balls to jump on.

The fifth room of this subchapter has a fairly simple solution to learn, jump onto the first conveyor as a fire ball brushes on top of it, drop just left of the middle of the second ring of fire balls and right dash out of it onto the next conveyor wall and simply jump from the top of it to the next with no delay after jumping off the third conveyor wall up-right dash in the middle of the fifth ring of fire balls to collect the dash crystal, heading right until level with the bottom of the final double-sided conveyor wall, after a very short wait shoot up the conveyor wall onto the other side and then immediately shoot up the right side, making the jump with the last dash.

The last room of the subchapter is rather difficult. Jump off when a fire ball of the first ring is pointing left and quickly double up-right dash and drop to the first dash crystal, repeat that to get the second dash crystal and then immediately up-right then right dash and drop in to get the third, from there up-right then upwards dash to hit the switch, bounce off of the two ice balls to the left and right of the first ice ring followed by all three from the current left to right of the next. On the next ice ring, jump off of the left ice ball and into the switch followed immediately by and upwards then up-right dash to drop into the next dash crystal with an up-right then right dash, dropping into the second last ring of fire balls, upon hitting the switch there should be an ice ball right under Madeline to bounce off and from there the player can make their way to the end by jumping off the ice balls.

If you are comfortable with neutral jumping, skipping the fire switch can make the first two rooms of [Heartbeat](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Heartbeat) easier. Ignore the switch and start climbing on the left wall, getting to the frozen platforms. Quickly jump off of them and dash towards the crystal, and after that you should be able to dash to the end of the room. The second room is also more straightforward as there's no need to use the switch on the left side, allowing the player to climb the right wall and start bouncing off of the ice balls.

The second room of the sub-chapter is mostly straight forward, though one thing of note is that it can be easier to reliably get inside the first ring of fire/ice balls by climbing and jumping off of the right wall.

The third room of the sub-chapter can seem impossible to learn at first due to its second half, though there is a strategy that one can use to make it easier. wait at the top of the last conveyor wall until a fire ball of the first ring of fire balls points down-right, follow this with two up-right dashes to the dash crystal followed by nothing but upwards dashes, though some minor delays and horizontal adjustments should be made after some of the upwards dashes.

The last room before the cassette block room can be difficult for people who aren't familiar with launching block momentum. It has a specific pattern that needs to be followed: stay slightly to the right from the middle of the first launching block, then grab the very top of the second block and at the end stay low on the second one, allowing you to use both dashes to get to the edge of the platform. If you miss the timing on the middle block, you can save yourself by either climbing or neutral jumping (the latter is safer though) to the top. It's recommended to practice this room a lot as launching block momentum can be pretty unforgiving.

### C-Side (8C)\[\]

This C-Side is mostly a matter of getting used to the third section. Try to get used to the momentum-based platforms and whenever you have time to wait, use it to max out the time that you will have to go through a part of the section. Hitting switches too early can sometimes end up with certain sections being very hard or impossible to clear. When dashing through the space blocks, if you do a horizontal dash through the second one followed by a space block jump, you can clear the third space block while keeping your dash, which can help make the next bumpers section much more consistent.

## [Chapter 9: Farewell](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_9:_Farewell)\[\]

Farewell's Golden Strawberry is located in the second subchapter, [Singular](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Singular). This means that the player can skip the first subchapter [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Farewell)) and go straight to the second subchapter using the menu.

The golden strawberry in Farewell is by far the most difficult one to obtain. Not only are there many extremely difficult rooms that can impede a player's progress, the chapter is also significantly longer than every other chapter in the game. Due to its absurd difficulty, Reddit user DJTom3 is attempting to keep track of everyone who has collected the Farewell Golden Strawberry with verified video proof. As of November 27, 2020, [the list](https://www.reddit.com/user/DJTom3/comments/k1hic9/celeste_farewell_golden_strawberry_collectors_list/) currently has 121 verified entries. [The Farewell Golden Collectors' List](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1FesTb6qkgMz-dCn7YdioRydToWSQNTg1axFEIHU4FF8/edit?gid=571489394#gid=571489394) is sill being updated every few weeks and count 837 players (15 December 2024).

Farewell has a variety of skips that can be used to make the level take less time, however some of them aren't very viable due to the high risk required to pass them.

One of the major skips is the [Power Source](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Power_Source) skip. In order to do it, the player needs to have a double dash, a jellyfish and they have to destroy the utility vault. Once it's done, they need to grab the jellyfish with the double dash and go into the hidden top room with the red bubble that leads to a key. The player can skip it by throwing a jellyfish into the tunnel, quickly entering the bubble and updashing into the jellyfish in the right moment to gain enough height to get to the next room. After that they have to perform a rather precise diagonal dash which leads to a hidden room which has fairly simple jumps. This skip can be difficult for some people, but once mastered, it may cut a lot of time for a golden run, especially considering it's fairly early in the level.

In [Remembered](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Remembered), it is possible to take a jellyfish to the room with tall falling blocks. It can be used to your advantage by updashing and collecting the refills to gain enough height.

It should be noted that the player sometimes has the option to do extended hyperdashes instead of wavedashes, a tougher technique although it can make some sections easier as they won't be as pressured to jump quickly from one platform to another. This may be especially useful for sections such as the "comb room", one of the rooms near the end of [Event Horizon](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Event_Horizon) with triggered platforms. Using an extended hyperdash here usually makes it easier for the player to align themselves to the wall bounce. Generally, watch for the triggered platform to pass the second pillar of crystals to do the wavedash/hyperdash, then for the second triggered platform, watch for it to just reach the first of the pillars of crystals to the right.

In the tutorial room with two wavedashes followed by a wall bounce, players can stay on the middle block and perform an extended hyperdash instead of a wavedash. If done right, they will grab the very right side of the wall, allowing them to jump to the left and use a wall bounce to get to the top of the platform. This strategy is less risky, because the player doesn't have to deal with momentum from speed tech.

The tenth room of Event Horizon can sort of skipped by grabbing the very bottom of the triggered platform, allowing you to pass under the crystals above and make the remainder of the room much easier. This strategy allows you to skip the key token in this room.

[Determination](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Determination) is often considered the hardest checkpoint due to a rather tricky rooms the player has to pass through. The first problematic room is the third room, containing a triggered platform with springs on both sides. Make sure to wait for a second when activating the platform, then jumping back right and quickly dashing up towards the crystal and keeping up with the platform. In the area with the double dash crystals, try to slow yourself down and not dash too immediately if needed to not be faster than the triggered platform.

In the first room with starblades, do a wavedash to the right when the starblades are at the bottom to ensure you can dodge them. In the large vertical room where you must fall past many starblades, do your wavedash or extended hyperdash when they are at the right side and don't be too averse to holding down to accelerate your descent if it would be safer.

The next hard room is the wind room with springs. With enough practice, it should be rather consistent, however this room needs to be taken very seriously as it's a common choke point. The following room with conveyors can be saved by neutral jumping off of the icy wall in case if you mess up or want to align yourself properly. The last room of Determination is mostly just memorizing how the starblades move, so they don't get in your way when the wind changes. Remember to not play around too much at the end, as being too slow often can result in Madeline being thrown into the starblades at the end of this section. Memorize how the starblades move on the first cycle of the room (aka the one when entering the room as opposed to after a respawn) as this will be what will most consistently occur in a Golden Strawberry run and is thus the most important muscle memory to gather.

The fourth room of [Stubbornness](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Stubbornness) has some rather tricky timing towards the end. Instead of trying to grab the pink wall, try to dash towards the blue block at the right timing, then jump back to the pink block and again jump towards the blue block to the very right. You have to time it properly so the previous blue block doesn't appear right in front of you.

[Reconciliation](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Reconciliation) is pretty straightforward for most of the time and there aren't many strategies to go speedily that a person can do. However, as this is very near the end of the chapter, it should be taken carefully and slowly whenever possible. In some of the last rooms, there are parts with moving blocks that have different strategies, so try to develop a consistent pattern that suits yourself. In the feather section with a lot of pufferfish scattered around, players can technically skip the feather by either using the fish or wavedashing off of the block at the bottom. [Farewell](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Farewell) is pretty much the same as in casual runs and it's recommended to take it slowly as being too hasty may end up with doing mistakes far in the level.

Farewell, unlike other chapters, has a secret room that can only be accessed when the player carries a Golden Berry. It's quite straightforward and it has very few difficult parts, but the player has no opportunity to practice it (unless they're using Debug Mode). There are binoculars that allow the player to check the layout of it, so be sure to look around to see what dangers are around and plan your strategies carefully. You have to be very careful, as failing in this room will take you to the very beginning of the level. If you don't care much about the surprise factor and you want to practice the room, you can use Debug Mode to teleport yourself to the room and mess around with it.

Due to the fact Farewell is very long, it's recommended to do individual runs of each checkpoint to be sure if you're able to complete it without dying. First, try to complete one of each checkpoint without dying, and then try to do two or more of them with as much fails as possible. Consistency is very important for this chapter, and it requires an insane amount of practice and good muscle memory to deal with the length of difficulty of this chapter. Watching someone go for the Golden Strawberry on this level in videos such as [this](https://youtu.be/niuCpSOX_jI) is recommended, as you then see the skips they make, and hopefully, that will help you.

# Chapter 2- Old Site

Chapter 2 shows off that Celeste is more than a traditional platformer by introducing some psychedelic mechanics during this dream chapter. This trippy chapter is clearly divided into three subchapters. The joy of exploration opens the chapter up and leads into a chase, while the closing allows time for reflection upon the game’s narrative.

Below is a list of all 18 strawberries for this level, as well as the locations for the cassette tape and the Crystal Heart.

### Strawberry \#1

After waking up in the dream and dropping into the entry way filled with light, you’ll come to a large, central room to this first portion of the chapter. Enter the room immediately to the left. You’ll enter a room with floating cubes and some have little seeds inside them. We’ll get the seeds later, but for now, smash the floor in the lower left corner to find a hidden room. Drop down and grab the strawberry.

### Strawberry \#2

Smash the wall in the bottom right of the central room. This path leads to a spiky room. Wall climb and use the green crystals to navigate the spikes safely to the other side. This leads to another room with spikes, but this one hides a succulent strawberry. Hop all the way across to the block on the right-hand side and ride it down as it falls. On the ground, you can dash through the wall to reveal a secret path to a strawberry.

### Strawberry \#3

After the creepy mirror encounter, the dream blocks will activate throughout the entire chapter. Leave the mirror room by traveling upward through the dream block and go to the room on the left. The second dream block in this room houses a secret location. Dash straight up into it to find a hidden room with a strawberry.

### Strawberry \#4

In the central room, make your way up to the left corner room. Inside will be a group of floating dream blocks and three of them will contain a seed. You need to use the blocks to dash around the room without touching the ground and gather all three seeds. When you do, a strawberry will form.

### Cassette Tape

Out in the central room, drop to the bottom to find a dream block in the ground. Dash down into it to find the hidden cassette tape room. The blue and pink platforms alternate based off the beat of the music. Time your jumps to navigate the room on the alternating platforms to grab the tape. This unlocks Chapter 2’s B Side level.

### Strawberry \#5

Head to the top of the central room and use the dream block at the top to go to the right. This room houses a couple of strawberries. You may notice the dream block on the ground has a small hole on the ground beneath it. Climb on top and dash through the floor to find a strawberry.

### Strawberry \#6

Head to the top of the central room and use the dream block at the top to go to the right. Activate the geared platform and then grab onto the dream block. Dash through when the geared platform is on the other side. Jump off and grab the strawberry and climb to safety.

### Strawberry \#7

Continuing in the top right room, go further to the right to find the next strawberry. Use the dream blocks to go over the spikes and grab the far right wall. Climb to secure the fruit and then dash your way back over the spikes, this time on the upper pathway.

### Strawberry \#8

At the top of the central room is a strawberry beneath the center dream block. Dash down and then immediately up to get the strawberry and to successfully avoid the spikes.

### Crystal Heart

The trick to this Crystal Heart is to take advantage of the ability to recharge your dash by changing the screen. Go back to the fire at the beginning of the level. You can dash upward into the next screen and zig zag back and forth to grab the wall above. Climb up the next screen.

Using the same zig zag method go left across the top screen so you can grab the outer wall at the end. Climb up to the top to find the Crystal Heart.

### Strawberry \#9

Leaving the central room the way you came in, head back out into the snow to find a tall dream block in the center. Dash straight up into it to gain access to a room off to the right. Inside is a small puzzle with dream blocks and spikes. Dash your way to the right wall and the fruit. Then use diagonal dashes to make your way back to safety.

## Intervention

This set of strawberries are all obtained during the chase with Badeline. You’ll have to stay on your toes as you stay ahead and collect the fruit!

### Strawberry \#10

On the second screen of the chase, you will see the strawberry in the upper right corner. Use the tall dream block to get into the corner by dashing diagonally. Grab the strawberry and jump over your doppelgänger to avoid being hit. Follow the route of the room to continue the chase.

### Strawberry \#11

This strawberry looks like it is in a tricky room, blocked off from you. The secret is to use the dream block to go up and then again to go left into the room with the strawberry. Remember to jump over the doppelgänger!

### Strawberry \#12

After the room with the four switches that lower the block that leads to escape is where this strawberry will be. Three apparitions will be chasing you now. Use the spring to climb the wall to reach the higher level. Up above you will see the strawberry. Climb the left wall straight up to it and then hop to the right wall and slide down so your pursuers won’t hit you!

### Strawberry \#13

In the room with no floor and two dream blocks is where you will find this strawberry. Dash through the first dream block and grab a hold of the second. Jump upward and dash to grab the spike free wall. Wall jump to the top to find a hidden room with the strawberry.

### Strawberry \#14

In the room with no floor and two dream blocks is where you will find this strawberry. After the two dream blocks is a blue block that falls when touched. Do not touch this block! Falling will cause it to obscure the strawberry. Instead, free fall from the second dream block and grab the wall to the left of the strawberry. Then leap off and dash over the spikes to solid ground.

### Strawberry \#15

The next room involves a long downward chase. Five doppelgängers will be chasing you. Starting on this screen, make your way to the blue block in the lower right corner. As you ride it down, you can catch a glimpse of the strawberry beneath it.

Cross the next room and when you reach the right-hand side climb upward to snag the strawberry you saw coming down.

### Strawberry \#16

With the chase over, you’ll enter a stretch with dream block columns. The fourth column is the key to this strawberry. Dive down into the dream block from the top to find a hidden room. Use the dream blocks in the middle to cross the room to the strawberry. Dive diagonally through them from the bottom. Use the same method to cross back to the other side.

### Strawberry \#17

With the chase over, you’ll enter a stretch with dream block columns. The fourth column is the key to this strawberry. Jump from the top of the column to find a room above. Dash up through the dream block here and collect the strawberry at the top. Use the dream block to go back and forth as you fall to avoid spikes.

## Awake

### Strawberry \#18

Once awake from the dream, you can walk the same path you did in the dream, but without the rad dream blocks. Talk to Theo up top, if you’d like. The room that had all the dream block columns now has springs. Above the fifth spring is a gap in the ceiling. Use the small platform near the spring to jump up and dash into. At the top is a room with a flying strawberry. Starting with the spring on the left, use the platforms and springs to get to the strawberry. You’ll need to dash into it. Make sure you are close enough or it will fly away.

# Chapter 4- Golden Ridge

The Golden Ridge will really try your patience. With its strong winds that push you around, bouncy clouds, moving blocks, and popping bubbles it will demand your accuracy. Fear not! It is possible and quite rewarding when completed. And when you collect every last secret, victory tastes so much sweeter.

Below is a list of all 29 strawberries for this level, as well as the locations for the cassette tape and the Crystal Heart.

## Start

### Strawberry \#1

After learning the two new mechanics for this chapter--the clouds and the bubbles—you’ll come to a calmer area marked by the old lady and her crow. Dash into the small cove to the left of the waterfall and walk through the wall to find the strawberry.

### Strawberry \#2

On the screen after talking with the old lady, you can spot the strawberry near the bottom. Use the wind to press you against the wall with the strawberry. Climb up and dash to the column in the middle. Hop to the other side and then jump to the ledge for safety.

### Strawberry \#3

Using the bubbles to break through the walls, you can spot the strawberry near the top between columns of spikes. Use the bubble beneath to dash up and grab the fruit. The bubble will return for you to continue dashing through the walls.

### Strawberry \#4

On the screen that intorduces the disappearing pink clouds you will see htis strawberry on the right side. Use the final cloud’s lift and a dash the nab it and then climb up to safety.

### Strawberry \#5

Similar to Strawberry #2, you’ll want to use the wind to collect this strawberry. Drop down to the wall adjacent to the strawberry. Use your dash to fight the rightward wind to get the strawberry. Use that wind to safely jump back to the other wall. Climb out and drop to the ground to secure the fruit.

### Strawberry \#6

After activating the switches to open the path, smash the suspicious looking block in the left corner to find this strawberry.

### Strawberry \#7

On the screen that has three clouds over a large hole with a leftward wind, use the second cloud to jump up and to the left. Dash to make it to the left corner where a secret path can be found.

There are four strawberry seeds on the screen. You must collect them all without your feet touching the ground to create a strawberry. Whenever you grab one seed, a leftward wind will immediately start blowing. You need to use this wind to navigate the room without touching the floor.

Starting on the right, climb the wall to grab the first seed. Use the wind to leap to the first column and then hop over to the spring on the other side. This spring recharges your stamina and dash. Fighting the wind, jump straight up and dash to grab the wall next to the second seed. Jump off and back down to the spring to recharge with two seeds in tow.

Grab onto the second column and hop over to its left side. Slide down and drop to the third seed, dashing up and to the left once you grab it. The wind will carry you to the third column. Your stamina will start to run low.

Hop of the third column and then to the left wall. Now wall jump up to the final seed to create the strawberry.

### Cassette Tape

On the screen that has three clouds over a large hole with a leftward wind, use the second cloud to jump up and to the left. Dash to make it to the left corner where a secret path can be found. Walk to the left on the screen with the seeds.

This is the cassette room. The blue and pink platforms alternate based off the beat of the music. Time your jumps to navigate the room on the alternating platforms to grab the tape. This unlocks Chapter 4’s B Side level.

### Strawberry \#8

Use the rightward wind to wall jump up the right-hand wall without using stamina. When the wind stops jump to the column near the strawberry, using your dash. Hop over the top and grab the strawberry. The wind will kick back up and blow you back to the right side where it is safe to land.

## Shrine

This area of the chapter features one off rooms that contain plenty of secrets and strawberries. Once you complete a room, it closes off to you from further access.

### Strawberry \#9 & 10

At the start of the shrine area, head into the open path to the right. You’ll find a moving block that you’ll have to navigate through gaps to reach the strawberries on the right. That’s correct—two strawberries!

The first is out in the open. Ride the block making sure it goes beneath the spike platforms. After jumping the second spike platform, press the block down so it can reach the far right wall. Jump and dash to grab Strawberry #9. Land on the platform again to regain your dash and grab the far right wall.

Dash through the block above to find Strawberry #10. Jump onto the left facing block and ride it back to secure both strawberries.

### Strawberry \#11

Back in the main area of the shrine, climb and dash up the left wall and enter the hallway. You can see the strawberry beneath the bridge. You’ll need to ride the moving block below to be able to grab the fruit.

Ride on the right-hand side of the block. Jump up to snag the strawberry and then dash back to the block to ride it to the other side.

### Strawberry \#12

Return to the main area of the shrine and use the moving block to go straight up. Inside this area you will find this strawberry. Use the moving blocks to cross the room and nab the fruit. Use the left facing block in the upper right corner to return back to the beginning.

### Strawberry \#13

Continuing upward through the main shrine area, enter the second entrance on the left side. This strawberry requires navigating a few rooms to get to it. Using the moving block to go left, thread it through the small gap in the platforms. Hop over the obstacles and land back on your moving block, pushing it down so you may reach the other side. Jump up and dash to the platform above.

In the next room you must use the upward moving block to reach bubbles at the top of the screen. Use the bubbles to make it to the top left corner and then navigate your way down the left side of the screen.

On the final screen, use the bubble to move diagonally toward the moving block. Use your dash to grab on and move it to the right. When it brteaks on the ceiling, drop down and to the right to land next to the strawberry.

### Strawberry \#14

Head to the area at the top of the shrine area screen. You’ll end up next to an outhouse. Use the pink cloud to hop onto the top of the moving block. Weave it up and down to reach the oppostie wall. Drop down to the next screen and walk over to get the strawberry.

### Strawberry \#15

Grab onto the moving block in the main area of the shrine and weave it to the left around the main obstacle. Go back to the right to reach the glowing area.

Hop into the water and swim to the right to find a hidden area with a strawberry. Smash the right wall to find more secrets!

### Strawberry \#16

Grab onto the moving block in the main area of the shrine and weave it to the left around the main obstacle. Go back to the right to reach the glowing area. Hop into the water and swim to the right to find a hidden area. Smash the right wall to find a room with a Super Mario Bros. 3-esque block. Pass the block for now and smash the right wall in this room.

The strawberry will be on the path above you. Use the moving blocks to move around the room to get the fruit. Jump onto the rightward moving block. Make sure to land on the upward block to move it out of the right block’s way.

Jump and dash up to the leftward block. Ride on this block and jump over any spikes in your way. Dash to the strawberry to collect it.

### Crystal Heart

Grab onto the moving block in the main area of the shrine and weave it to the left around the main obstacle. Go back to the right to reach the glowing area. Hop into the water and swim to the right to find a hidden area. Smash the right wall to find a room with a Super Mario Bros. 3-esque block.

This is more than a visual homage to the classic platformer. Just like in SMB3, hold down on the white block until you drop into the background. Using the light pink rocks that made up the background, climb up to the top area of the screen to find the Crystal Heart. Dash into it to collect it.

### Strawberry \#17

During the final stretch of the shrine subchapter is where you will find this strawberry. You’ll use a cloud to reach a moving block. You need to weave the block through the obstacles to reach the end. On the path, you will seee the strawberry in a small area above.

On the small stretch of ground before the strawberry, drop down from the platform and grab onto its left side. Jump up and dash through the strawberry and land back on the block to ride it to the right side of the screen.

## Old Trail

### Strawberry \#18

Right at the start of the old trail, use the wind to wall jump up the left wall. At the top is an entry point to a room with a flying strawberry. Use the wind to land on the left wall. Climb up to the height of the strawberry and then dash into it. As you fall, hold grab so that you can grab the right wall and climb to safety.

### Strawberry \#19

You can spot this strawberry at the bottom of the screen near the beginning of the Old Trail. Fighting the wind, jump and dash up the the small "L" shaped platform up above. Now jump and dash into the bubble. Using the bubble, go to the left to land on the strawberry. Diagonally dash up to grab the column wall and climb to safety.

### Strawberry \#20

You can see this strawberry as you ride on a moving block with spikes on the left side. It’ll be at the end of the ride with a bubble leading to safety. While riding the block, you need to use the bubble to replenish your dash. Jump into the bubble and exit to the right, making sure to grab back onto the moving block.

Ride the block all the way to the right and climb up to collect the strawberry. Drop down and use the wind combined with your dash to get back to the bubble and use it to get to safety.

### Strawberry \#21

After using four moving blocks to navigate a room full of spikes, you’ll see an entry way to the left. It leads to a strawberry room that revolves around wind. A strong leftward wind will be blowing. Use it and a dash to reach the strawberry.

Climb up to the green crystal. Using the crystal, dash diagonally to the second green crystal to refresh your dash. Use this refresh to dash right into the small block.

Wait for the second crystal to regenerate. Once it does, jump and dash into the bubble. Exit the bubble to the right and dash immediately to make it to the small column. Make a small up to regenerate your dash. Slide down the column and dash immediately to the right to ensure you land on solid ground.

### Strawberry \#22

Continuing up through the room with four moving blocks to navigate through the spikes, you’ll spot this strawberry. It is in a precarious position above spikes with a switch block. Ride the moving block to the right and leap off before it gets to the wall, making sure to stop at the switch. Wait for the switch block to move all the way over. Using the switch itself as a marker, jump off and dash over the spikes to snag the fruit and grab onto the switch block. Quickly climb out and fall to safety before your stamina depletes.

### Strawberry \#23

This strawberry is in the room with springs at the beginning. You’ll use the springs to reach bubbles and this is where you can spot your target. The strawberry is floating above spikes. You need to time your use of the bubbles to launch at the strawberry and then combining your dash with the wind safely grab onto the wall. Climb into the bubble and launch yourself back down toward the springs to go get Strawberry #24. If you only want/need this strawberry, continue up the screen.

### Strawberry \#24

This strawberry is in the room with springs at the beginning. You’ll use the springs and wind to launch into the cracked wall on the right. This hidden room is filled with bubbles that you’ll need to use to reach the top. Dash and climb your way up. You can see the strawberry beneath the final bubble. Launch down to the strawberry from the final bubble and grab onto one of the walls to wait for the bubble to return. Then use it to escape the room by going up.

## Cliff Face

### Strawberry \#25

At the start of the Cliff Face sub-chapter you can see a small crack on the ceiling. Using the cracked rock you can climb up and dash into the hole in the ceiling. Don’t worry if ypu smashed the block. You can still jump and dash your way up there, it’s just a tad trickier.

The trick to this strawberry room is to be on the far side of a couple of the moving blocks so that you may reach the far off platforms. Hop onto the left side of the first moving block and move it to the left. When it reaches the top, leap off and dash into the bubble. Exit the bubble to the left and immediately dash upward to avoid the spikes. Grab the wall and hop onto the next moving block.

Navigate the block through the hole and then back to the right, moving it to be close to the next block. Jump over to the third block’s right side and execute the same technique as before. At the top jump into the bubble below.

Use the bubble to grab onto the final moving block and ride it halfway up, being mindful of the spikes waiting at the very top. Drop down and dash horizontally through the gap in the spikes to snag the strawberry and land safely.

### Strawberry \#26

This strawberry is easy to spot. It can be found floating beneath four disappearing platforms. Fight the wind by jumping and dashing to reach each platform. On the final one, jump back to nab the fruit and then dash upward to ride the wind back to a previous platform.

### Strawberry \#27

When giant snowballs start targeting you, then you’ll know you are near this strawberry. Fight the wind and dodge the snowballs as you cross the screen until you spot the fruit near the top. Make your way to the nearby bubble and launch up to float back toward the strawberry. Land on a platform to secure it.

### Strawberry \#28

This strawberry can be found above the second bubble on the screen after the snowballs. Simply dash up from the second bubble to get the fruit and wait for the bubble to regenerate.

### Strawberry \#29

This strawberry is on the final screen of the chapter. You’ll know you are there when you use a strong rightward wind to leap to bubbles. After passing the spiked column you can see the fruit beneath a bubble and spikes.

Use the closer bubble to launch toward the strawberry. Once you touch it, dash immediately upward to land in the second bubble. From here, exit straight up and ride the wind with one diagonal dash to safely grab the fall and climb to safety.

# Cassette Tape

From Celeste Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#searchInput)

| Found in | [1](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City)  •  [2](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site)  •  [3](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort) [4](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge)  •  [5](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple)  •  [6](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection) [7](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit)  •  [8](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core) |

**Cassette Tapes** are special entities in the A-Sides of chapters 1 through 8. They unlock each chapter's respective [B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#B-Sides). As such, collecting them is required to unlock a chapter's red crystal heart, and all of them must be collected before the C-Sides are unlocked. Cassette Tapes are always in a Cassette Room, featuring [Cassette Blocks](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Block) and an 8-bit remix of the chapter's music. Collecting a Cassette Tape will always lead to Madeline being transported, via bubble, back to the beginning of the room she came from (in [8A](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#A-Side) she gets bubbled to the end instead).

At the level select screen, you can see the checkpoint where the cassette tape (along with strawberries) is found, which can help you locate it.

## Locations of Cassette Tapes

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=1)\]

**Thou hast been warned!**

This section contains spoilers for Celeste. Do not read the following section if you wish to avoid spoilers for Celeste.

### [Forsaken City](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=2)\]

The cassette is hidden at the beginning of the Chasm checkpoint. To find it, go past the zipper on the left to reach an optional area, and then stand on the next zipper and launch yourself upwards. It will take you to a berry room. In the wall to the left is the hole, covered by another zip mover. Grab it to get it out of the way, and the cassette room can be found past the gap in the wall.

### [Old Site](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=3)\]

It's found in the Start checkpoint. Go down-right to activate the dream blocks, and after coming back to the "hub" section, fall to the very bottom and dash through the dream block in the ground.

### [Celestial Resort](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=4) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=4)\]

The cassette can be found in Elevator Shaft. Get to the key room and the entrance will be visible on the very far left. It's indicated by a light beam coming out of the hole.

### [Golden Ridge](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=5) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=5)\]

The cassette is fairly early in the Start checkpoint. After passing through the touch switch room, the next room has a hidden entrance that can be seen in the top-left corner. Use the second white cloud to reach this height, and run to the left of the berry room which takes you to another hidden area with the tape.

### [Mirror Temple](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=6) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=6)\]

This cassette is found in the Depths checkpoint and can be easily missed if you aren't exploring the entire map. After going past two rooms to the right of where you first encounter [Theo](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo) in the mirror, fall off the metal platform and take a red booster to the right. Then, pass the next room and the one after it to get to a room with [strawberry seeds](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Strawberry_seeds). Finally, go through a cracked wall on the right to enter the cassette room.

### [Reflection](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=7) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=7)\]

It's found in the Hollows checkpoint, behind a breakable wall on the bottom-left side. Take a Kevin block to the bottom and let it break the wall, opening the way to the cassette tape room.

### [The Summit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=8) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=8)\]

It can be found in the 5th room of 1500m by going through an optional path at the top. It's easily noticeable, but you must dodge a moving dust bunny that blocks the pathway.

### [Core](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=9) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=9)\]

The Cassette Tape room is right at the end, and you _must_ collect it to get to the Crystal Heart and complete the chapter.

## Trivia

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=10) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=10)\]

- The original method of obtaining the Cassette Tapes was going to be by collecting several music notes. The player would have to grab multiple of them without touching the ground, similar to how [Strawberry Seeds](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Collectables#Strawberry_Seeds) work in the final game.[\[1\]](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#cite_note-1)
- In [Celeste 64](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste_64), the cassette tapes don't unlock B-Sides, but upon touching them, the player is transported to a room with a strawberry and Cassette Blocks.

1. [↑](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#cite_ref-1)Maddy Thorson, [Celeste Developer Commentary Livestream](https://youtu.be/u-nSjhIgmXc?si=FIAOVoy2dbKb98CJ&t=928) on YouTube
