**Chapter 3: Celestial Resort** is the third chapter of [Celeste](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Celeste). This chapter features a variety of new objects, as well as the introduction of Oshiro, a new and important character to the story. Chapter 3 runs the player through a run-down hotel, and they are tasked with helping Oshiro (the hotel's owner) clean it up. _But something mysterious and ominous lurks..._

## **Plot**\[\]

**I tried to warn you.**

This section contains spoilers for Chapter 3: Celestial Resort. Do not read the following section if you wish to avoid spoilers for Chapter 3: Celestial Resort.

Madeline finds a decrepit hotel, then bypasses animated globs of slime to gain access to the hotel's front door. Upon entering the hotel, Madeline finds an old and damaged guestbook with ominous glowing comments. Madeline then rings the bell at the front desk, summoning a ghostly figure. Madeline is shocked by the presence of a ghost, but he assures her that there's nothing wrong, presenting himself as Mr. Oshiro, the Celestial Resort Hotel's concierge. He assumes that Madeline will stay at the hotel, but Madeline insists that she's just passing through; Mr. Oshiro, refusing to believe that Madeline is leaving, begins escorting Madeline to the hotel's presidential suite, hoping that it will convince her to stay at the hotel.

As Madeline follows Mr. Oshiro through the hotel, Mr. Oshiro becomes increasingly flustered by Madeline's comments on the poor state of the hotel, eventually leading him to lose hope due to the hotel's large amount of clutter. Madeline decides to stay behind to help Mr. Oshiro clean up the hotel. In the process of doing so, Madeline encounters Theo, who distrusts Mr. Oshiro and wants for Madeline and himself to leave through a nearby air vent; Madeline refuses Theo's offer, thinking that she can get through to Mr. Oshiro and help him, so Theo leaves by himself.

Eventually, Madeline manages to clean up the hotel, although she becomes annoyed by Mr. Oshiro's attempts to make her feel like the hotel's service level is high enough that her efforts are unnecessary. Mr. Oshiro then takes Madeline to the hotel's presidential suite in a desperate attempt to keep her as a guest, but the two become separated when Mr. Oshiro has a breakdown in front of the suite's entryway and inadvertently clogs up the passage between Madeline and himself with globs of slime, forcing Madeline to take an alternative route to catch up with Mr. Oshiro. On this alternative route, Madeline encounters Mr. Oshiro's decades-old diary, the final entry of which details Mr. Oshiro's refusal to part with the hotel when it closed at around the time that the diary dated to.

Madeline finally arrives at the presidential suite. There, Mr. Oshiro worriedly tries to win her over with the suite's amenities; Madeline indicates somewhat facetiously that she likes the suite, but can't stay despite the suite's niceness. Mr. Oshiro argues with Madeline, trying to keep her there, until [Badeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Badeline) appears in the presidential suite's mirror, breaks out of the mirror, and severely reprimands Mr. Oshiro for trying to make Madeline stay there when the hotel was low-quality. Madeline tries to console Mr. Oshiro, but he becomes angry and tells her and Badeline to leave, which they do (made possible by Badeline breaking a hole in the ceiling).

Outside, Badeline smugly compliments herself for having rescued Madeline. Annoyed, Madeline tries to make Badeline leave, resulting in Badeline mocking her for abandoning her goal of climbing the mountain to help Mr. Oshiro. Mr. Oshiro arrives and glumly asks Madeline to tell him why she would help him and then ditch him, leading Badeline to tell Mr. Oshiro that Madeline was only helping Mr. Oshiro out of a selfish desire to feed her ego. As Madeline tries to dispel this explanation, Badeline disappears, leaving Madeline to deal with a now enraged Mr. Oshiro, who proceeds to chase Madeline across the hotel's roof.

At the rooftop's edge, despite Madeline's frightened pleadings, Mr. Oshiro destroys the awning that he and Madeline are now perched on, sending the two down to the hotel's back exit on ground level. Mr. Oshiro, now back to normal, decides sadly to close the hotel for repairs. He then leaves, asking Madeline to leave him alone; after slight hesitation, Madeline does this, continuing on her journey.

## **Major Strategies**\[\]

An interesting feature of 3A is shaftskip. This uses a pixel-perfect demodash to clip through a wall of dust bunnies, saving about 12 seconds. This works because the demodash reduces the vertical extent of Madeline's hitbox such that it becomes possible to fit between the hitboxes of the individual blob spike objects. This is possible with most blob spikes in the game, but because it is pixel-perfect and nowhere else does it save anywhere near as much time, shaftskip is the only instance of this trick being viable in full game runs. It has been used in the tape room of 3B, however, and is conjectured to be viable in a few other levels (mostly C-sides) as well but has not been successfully applied in those.

**Start** is the first subchapter of [Chapter 3: Celestial Resort](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort) B-Side in [Celeste](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Celeste). The subchapter returns the player to the entrance of [Mr. Oshiro's](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Mr._Oshiro) resort and has them enter in. There's a small secret found in this subchapter to get a glimpse at some birds using skull binoculars.

## Contents

- [1**Gameplay**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Celestial_Resort_B-Side)#Gameplay)
 - [1.1**Strategies**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Celestial_Resort_B-Side)#Strategies)
 - [1.2**Secret Bird Room**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Celestial_Resort_B-Side)#Secret_Bird_Room)
- [2**Gallery**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Celestial_Resort_B-Side)#Gallery)

## **Gameplay**\[\]

Though in the first two rooms there aren't any sludge-related enemies to be seen, in the third room the player enters into the hotel and from there tons of these sludges will be in the rest of the rooms. The third room of the subchapter will focus on circling sludges, while the rest of the following rooms will use many moving sludges all across.

### **Strategies**\[\]

Room 1

This room will just have you jump over the gap and dash straight to the right, grabbing the ledge if needed, and reaching the end.

Room 2

In this room, you'll need to do a lot of wrap-around wall jump to descend while dodging spikes. Jump on the spring and do a diagonal up-right dash to the right side of the top floating platform. Wall jump to the right, then start moving back left as you approach the next one and repeat until reaching the dash crystal. It's entirely possible to also just go underneath the first two floating platforms and dash into the third one, saving a bit of time. After touching the dash crystal, dash diagonally up-right and you can either wall jump to the left and then back right or just climb up this floating platform and jump over it to the right. From there just get over the last floating platform and wall jump off, then you're at the door to the hotel.

Room 3

There are very many circling sludges in this room and stamina will be tight here. Jump to the first platform when it's safe, then wait until you can jump and dash diagonally up-right to grab the platform up above, then climb on top of it. After the circling sludge around you passes, jump right and dash straight right to climb the platform you reach, then jump over the sludge on top of it and grab its right side when it's safe to do so. When the coast is clear, jump to the next floating platform and again climb it and jump over the sludge on top, then jump to the next floating platform where it's safe to stand. In this next section, you'll want to be quick. Jump and dash up-right to climb the floating platform above and jump to the right side of it when you can. Grab on and wait until you can jump to the next nearby platform, where you should do the same thing. Then, before you run out of stamina, jump to the last platform, which will fall if you wait too long so just get off it quick and you've finished the room.

Room 4

Watch the first two moving sludges until they're both at their highest, and when they are you should jump to the wall and do a wall jump off, then swiftly do another off the left wall to go all the way right and reach the bottom of the right side of the floating platform. Quickly jump off to the right and dash straight up, then jump to the right side and grab the wall while collecting the dash crystal. Watching to your right now, wait until the nearby two moving sludges reach their lowest point to fall down and dash diagonally up-right and grab the platform. When the moving sludge on the left goes back up, jump to its wall, then wall jump back to the right and weave inbetween the other two moving sludges to then wall jump off the floating platform and reach the end of the room.

Room 5

Walk into the spring and dash up-right and fall to the dash crystal. When you reach the dash crystal, dash in any direction that will prevent you from hitting a moving sludge and hold onto the wall. Do wall jumps back and forth until the dash crystal comes back, then time your wall jumps to get over a moving sludge as it goes down to allow yourself to climb up and dash up-right over the pile of sludge above. Do your dash when the moving sludges in the right corridor are both at the edges. Then, climb up the right wall to move past the moving sludge right as it goes left and then jump up and dash to the right. Do your dash when the moving sludge at the right of your position starts to move left and hold right as much as possible. Then, as you fall, hold left to dodge the other moving sludge and you'll be safe.

Room 6

In this room, cycles are very inconsistent, so for the safest way to line yourself up you should bounce off the first spring and then dash diagonally up-right to grab the wall. From here, wait until the moving platform reaches the left and the moving sludge is not going left to fall onto the moving platform and bounce on the spring. For the bottom key token, find a time to fall in the middle when both the moving platform and moving sludge won't be there, then dash straight to the left or right and hold the wall until you can jump up to the moving platform safely. For the key token above you, stall constantly by doing a straight upward dash and landing back on the spring until you find a moment to dash up above a moving sludge and wall jump to the key token, then fall and land on the moving spring again. After these two key tokens have been collected, get the third and last one at the top right by bouncing up with the spring to then climb up the left side. When you can, jump to the right and dash straight right into the key token and grab the wall. When the moving sludge goes down, jump over it and then fall back to the right to reach the end of the room.

### **Secret Bird Room**\[\]

By going to the left of the first room of the subchapter, a secret room is reached. This room seems pretty barren, having only a platform far to the left with spikes on top of it. By doing a wavedash to the left, you can get to this platform and use your dash to get across the spikes. Another platform left of the spiked one can be reached which just has skull binoculars on it. By viewing it and holding left for a few seconds, you'll eventually come across a platform with some birds on it at the far-left side of the room. Getting back from this area is barely possible with a wavedash at the right edge and a diagonal up-right dash to just be able to reach the ledge you started at and climb up it. Notably, if you go to this room and die, the Golden Strawberry will no longer spawn in the first room of the subchapter unless you restart the chapter. This doesn't happen if you bring the Golden Strawberry into this room, though.

Cassette Tape in-game sprite

**B-Side Cassette Tapes** (or simply **Cassettes** for short) are collectible items, one of which can be found in each of the story chapters. Obtaining a chapter's Cassette is required in order to unlock the chapter's B-side level, which uses the mechanics of its respective chapter but is significantly harder. Cassettes are always obtainable in their own room after a gauntlet of [Rhythm Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Rhythm_Blocks). The following page details how to obtain these Cassettes.

- [3Chapter 3: Celestial Resort](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort)

- [7Chapter 7: The Summit](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_7:_The_Summit)
- [8Chapter 8: Core](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_8:_Core)

## Chapter 1: Forsaken City\[\]

This chapter's Cassette room can be found in this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Chasm". If the player goes behind the [Traffic Light Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Traffic_Light_Blocks) in the sub-chapter's first room, then goes two rooms up, and then goes behind the next Conveyor-belt Platform, the Cassette room will become accessible.

## Chapter 2: Old Site\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's first sub-chapter, "Start", but only after the mirror encounter with [Badeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Badeline). The player must go down as soon as they enter the large room (the first one where the player has any agency over movement), and must then dash down through the [Dream Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dream_Blocks) in the floor of said room, exposing the Cassette room.

## Chapter 3: Celestial Resort\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Elevator Shaft", just to the left of the chapter's singular [Key](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Keys) (indicated by the opening through a broken wall with light shining out of it).

## Chapter 4: Golden Ridge\[\]

This chapter's Cassette can be found in this chapter's first sub-chapter, "Start". Just after finishing the room that requires the player to collect two [Shields](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shields) in order to move a [Shield-Activated Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shield-Activated_Platforms), the player must bounce on the second [White Cloud](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/White_Clouds) from the left, then dash up and left in order to access the top-left corner of the room. The player must then go as far left as possible, passing through the following room (which should contain a number of [Springs](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs) and strawberry fragments in order to find this Cassette's room.

## Chapter 5: Mirror Temple\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's second sub-chapter, "Depths". After passing the third [Temple Gate](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Temple_Gates)—the one just after a challenge involving a single [Swap Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Swap_Blocks)—the player should head down and to the right in order to find a hidden room leading to a [Red Orb](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Red_Orbs). Taking this orb to the right will lead to a platforming segment; completing this segment and pressing the [Dash Switch](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dash_Switches) there will open another Temple Gate to the bottom right of this room. Clearing this second room by depressing its Dash Switch will open yet another Temple Gate at the bottom right of this following room, leading to a third, more illuminated room. At the bottom right of this third room, the player can simply walk through a section of cracked wall (with or without completing any associated challenges) to access the Cassette room.

## Chapter 6: Reflection\[\]

This Cassette can be found in the first room of this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Hollows". To access the Cassette room, the player must use the nearby [Kevin Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Kevin_Blocks) to break the wall below it and send the Block to the bottom of the lake. The player must then quickly attack the Kevin Block again to make it break the wall to its left, exposing the entryway into the Cassette room.

## Chapter 7: The Summit\[\]

This chapter's Cassette can be found in its fourth sub-chapter, "1500M". Upon entering this sub-chapter's fifth room, an opening can be seen leading out the top of the room. Entering this opening will lead to the cassette room.

## Chapter 8: Core\[\]

This cassette lies at the end of the chapter and is required to complete it.

[![Crystal Heart](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/42/Crystal_Heart.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/100?cb=20180717094116)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/42/Crystal_Heart.png/revision/latest?cb=20180717094116)

A blue Crystal Heart.

Blue **Crystal Hearts** are collectibles throughout the game and are one of the three types of hearts which are used to unlock various gates throughout the game such as [Chapter 8](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_8) and its alternate sides as well as [Chapter 9](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_9) past the heart gate in [Event Horizon](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Event_Horizon) (see [this page](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Collectibles#Crystal_Hearts) for more information on the different types of hearts). The following page details how to obtain the blue Crystal Hearts in the game.

## Chapter 1\[\]

[![Pointless Machine Achievement](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/55/Pointless_Machine_Achievement.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180820205431)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/55/Pointless_Machine_Achievement.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180820205431)

Pointless machines

The Crystal Heart in this chapter can be found in [Chapter 1](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1)'s second sub-chapter, [Crossing](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crossing). After passing the house, the player must get on the first [Conveyor-Belt Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Conveyor-Belt_Platforms) in the following room and advance to the second as usual; however, on the second Conveyor-Belt Platform, the player must jump left as they're flung into the air and dash upwards to the left of the up sign, revealing a secret passage. The player must then dash to the left from there to get to the room connecting to this screen's top-left corner. After a few screens, the player will arrive at the location of a computer. Here the Crystal Heart puzzle begins.

The computer will flash a sequence of colors; nearby, there will be a number of small, colored birds, each of whom corresponds with a color that the computer flashes. The computer will flash a series of colors intermittently, followed by the birds all moving in different directions. To obtain the heart, one must pay attention to the sequence of colors that the computer flashes, as well as the directions that the birds move in every time the sequence finishes. The player must dash in the direction that each bird corresponds to in the order in the computer's light sequence where that bird's color appears on the computer (in relation to the other colors, not in real time). The direction sequence that the player must perform is:

[![Celeste Birds](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20201006071705)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest?cb=20201006071705)

Color Directions

- Up (White)
- Left (Purple)
- Down-Right (Blue)
- Up-Right (Red)
- Left (Purple)
- Up-Left (Yellow)

Performing this series of dashes will cause the birds to form into this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Pointless machines_) which the player can then obtain.

## Chapter 2\[\]

[![Resurrections](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/5e/Resurrections.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213173921)

Resurrections

The Crystal Heart in this chapter is located in [Chapter 2](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_2)'s first sub-chapter, [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Old_Site)). In theory, this Crystal Heart should be quite easy to locate, being two screens up from the starting screen of the chapter. In practice, it is very difficult to locate, as there are no [objects](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Objects) that will help one to get there. One of the ways to get there is by exploiting a piece of the game's physics that recharges the player's dash when the player moves from one screen to another. This mechanic is not directly taught in the game (although it is indirectly taught when the player attempts to collect an early strawberry in [Chapter 3](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort)), and for this reason, it is regarded by many as one of the hardest Crystal Hearts to find without a guide. The mechanic allows the player to essentially climb thin air by dashing off of the right side of the first screen onto the second screen, then back, repeating until the player moves up to the screen above the first screen. After climbing up a wall from this third screen onto a fourth screen, the player can then fall down onto the third screen, dash onto the fourth screen, and repeat until one finds a wall. The player can then climb this wall, after which the player can easily reach the topmost screen, where one can simply walk over to this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Resurrections_) and obtain it.

Another way to get to this crystal heart is to first get onto the second screen, climb up the wall, stand on the left edge of the platform above the second screen, jump to the far left of the platform and then dash left as soon as the player leaves the screen. By doing so, the player lands on the platform on the left and can then continue climbing up towards the crystal heart.

The heart can also be seen (but not obtained) in the [Awake](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Awake) subchapter of Chapter 2, where it is easier to locate, and a poem lies near it with hints of how to obtain it:

_An apparition_

_Not of this world_

_But because of it_

_Lurking_ _**out of frame**_

_Awake, my heart is a fortress_

_**In dreams I am vulnerable**_

## Chapter 3\[\]

[![Scattered and lost](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/7/7f/Scattered_and_lost.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213174144)

Scattered and lost

The Crystal Heart in [Chapter 3](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3) is located in the second sub-chapter, [Huge Mess](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Huge_Mess). After being tasked to help clean up by Mr. Oshiro, the player must advance to the lower path of the two in the upper right corner. Once the player reaches and activates the large button to clear the purple and white towels, one must advance not to the left as usual, but to the right. The player must then travel up into the crevice that a stream of water is falling out of to reveal a secret path, leading back to one of the earlier rooms of the path. One must then advance upwards and then to the left (in reverse of the way the player first goes through the area) until the player reaches the first room, where the player first runs into Theo in Chapter 3. There is a path at the top of the screen that was previously blocked by towels; the player must dash up to this path and follow it upward to find this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Scattered and lost_) and obtain it.

## Chapter 4\[\]

[![Eye of the storm](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e4/Eye_of_the_storm.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213174319)

Eye of the storm

[Chapter 4](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_4)'s Crystal Heart is located at the very beginning of the second sub-chapter, [Shrine](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shrine). To reach the Crystal Heart, the player must cling to the [Guided Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Guided_Platforms), then navigate it left to avoid hitting the wall, after which the player should move it back to the right. Once the player lands, the player must go to the right, into the lit up area. Once one goes into the next room, the player should see a waterfall pouring into a pool of [water](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Water). The player must then swim towards the bottom right corner, and keep swimming to the right until the player reaches a hidden area with a strawberry. The player must then dash into the [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls) to the right to break it, after which the player should reach a tall room. One cannot reach the top normally; the player must crouch on top of the room's idiosyncratic white block until the player disappears. The player is now in the background instead of the foreground, thus allowing one to interact with objects in the background (a trick borrowed from [Super Mario Bros. 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Mario_Bros._3), which has a similar block with a similar gimmick). This object interaction allows the player to climb to the top of the screen, where the Crystal Heart (entitled _Eye of the storm_) is located.

## Chapter 5\[\]

[![Quiet and falling](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e2/Quiet_and_falling.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175216)

Quiet and falling

[Chapter 5](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_5)'s Crystal Heart is located in the second sub-chapter, [Depths](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Depths). After getting the key above the statue, the player must enter the room beneath the statue to the right, then hop on the nearby bubble and travel to the right. Instead of opening the door at the end of the room, the player must enter a second bubble and travel to the left, then dash up into the center of the second platform on their way back. This moves the player into a third bubble that they can use to travel upwards, leading to a secret path above the door. After making their way through the long hallway to reach the next room and going through that room as normal, the player must now head to the bottom of the following room and dash downwards to break the brown [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls) in the floor. This reveals another locked door that they can use the key on, which leads to the Crystal Heart's room. In order to navigate in the room, one must go along the outer edges of the room, using a set of moving blocks and platforms to get to the Crystal Heart (entitled _Quiet and falling_) and obtain it.

## Chapter 6\[\]

[![Heavy and frail](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/4d/Heavy_and_frail.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175253)

Heavy and frail

[Chapter 6](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_6:_Reflection)'s Crystal Heart is located at the beginning of the third sub-chapter, [Hollows](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Hollows). At the start of the sub-chapter, the player must use the [Angry Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Angry_Platforms) to break through the wall below to get to the first [Feather](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Feathers). One must then use it to fly up-right, and then dash down to break the [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls), revealing the second Feather. The player must use that Feather to fly upwards, then climb to the third Feather, and finally use that Feather to fly to the left of the screen, revealing an entrance to a secret room. After going through the room and breaking another Smashable Wall, the player will see a puzzle with a statue, 6 colored crystals, 4 torches and 3 symbols.

[![Celeste Birds](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest?cb=20201006071705)

Bird Color Directions (see Chapter 1)

In order to solve the puzzle, one must repeat the pattern required to obtain the first chapter's Crystal Heart; doing so correctly will light up the first torch. The same thing must be done for the rest, but with slight alterations for each following torch: the second torch's pattern must be the first, but mirrored left-right (e.g an up-left on the first torch must be an up-right dash for the second); the third torch's pattern has to be mirrored up-down (e.g. an upwards dash on the first must be a downwards dash for the third), and the fourth one's pattern must be mirrored both up-down and left-right (e.g. an up-left dash on the first must be a down-right dash for the fourth). For a complete list of directions, see below:

- First torch: Up, Left, Down-Right, Up-Right, Left, Up-Left
- Second torch: Up, Right, Down-Left, Up-Left, Right, Up-Right
- Third torch: Down, Left, Up-Right, Down-Right, Left, Down-Left
- Fourth torch: Down, Right, Up-Left, Down-Left, Right, Down-Right

After lighting up all 4 torches, the Crystal Heart (entitled _Heavy and frail_) will be granted on top of the statue.

## Chapter 7\[\]

[![Pink sunrise](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/c/c3/Pink_sunrise.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175701)

Pink sunrise

To obtain the crystal heart in [Chapter 7](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_7), you must find six Jewels hidden in each subchapter— a blue star for Reflection at the [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(The_Summit)), a sapphire square for Forsaken City at [500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/500_M), an emerald oval for Old Site at [1000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1000_M), a gold circle for Celestial Resort at [1500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1500_M), a pink diamond for Golden Ridge at [2000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2000_M), and a white pearl for Mirror Temple at [2500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2500_M). You obtain the crystal heart in [3000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/3000_M) after getting all the Jewels.

#### Star\[\]

The first Jewel is located at the end of the last screen of the Start subchapter. After bouncing off of the last [Spring](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs), the player must use both dashes to jump over the final [Purple Orb](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Purple_Orbs), then climb up the wall on the right. The screen should move, revealing the first Jewel.

#### Sapphire\[\]

The route to 500 M's Jewel starts in the sub-chapter's 3rd screen, where, after going up on the first [Traffic Light Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Traffic_Light_Blocks), the player must go left instead of going right at the intersection. The player should then go right after climbing to the top of the tall screen that follows. In the following room, just to the right of the second Traffic Light Block, there is a tiny gap in the ground, which the player must fall through to find the room with the second Jewel. Completing the spike-lined obstacle course will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Emerald\[\]

For 1000 M's Jewel, the player must go through the upper left or upper right route of the 5th screen of the subchapter. If you choose the upper left route, you have to go up through the first [Space Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Space_Blocks), then use the Space Block on the right to break a [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls). You will then enter into a room with a strawberry. Going up through the spiked platform will lead you to the path to the Jewel. Going the upper right route will skip the berry. The player must dash to the right in the middle of two Space Blocks to break a Smashable Wall; breaking this wall will reveal another room with [Skull Binoculars](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Skull_Binoculars), as well as with a concealed [Disappearing Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Disappearing_Platforms) which the player must stand on to fall to the chamber below. Completing this chamber will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Gold\[\]

1500 M's Jewel is at the end of the 7th screen of the subchapter and is probably the easiest one to find. Below the exit upwards into the 8th screen, a broken wall can be seen. Going through there and completing the room that it reveals will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Diamond\[\]

2000 M's Jewel is a trek to get to. To the left of the second room is a seemingly pointless room. In one of the gaps above the player (the widest one above the pit of [Crystal Spikes](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Spikes)), there is a secret platform to stand on, which the player can use to jump all the way to the left of the screen. In the next screen, there is a broken area of the roof, providing another entrance to a secret platform. The player must get there, jump off to the left, dash up to the left, and then dash up as soon as the player is past the wall that they need to climb up. Going up through the hole will reveal the Jewel.

#### Pearl\[\]

To reach 2500 M's Jewel, the player must take the first Red Bubble left, causing it to break the wall at the left of the first screen. The player must then enter the Red Bubble in the newly revealed screen and take that to the right, causing it to break several more walls before it eventually stops moving. The player must then go up and complete the following screen to obtain this Jewel.

#### Crystal Heart\[\]

At checkpoint 28 at 3000 M, the player must dash under the gap in the wall to the player's right, causing the camera to move and reveal the room with the Crystal Heart. If the player has all of the Jewels, they will pop out of the floor, and the Crystal Heart (entitled _Pink sunrise_) will move to a place where the player can obtain it.

## Chapter 8\[\]

[![Heart of the Mountain](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/1/19/Heart_of_the_Mountain.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175751)

Heart of the mountain

The Crystal Heart in [Chapter 8](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_8) is the most straightforward to obtain, as it is required to obtain at the end of the fourth subchapter, [Heart of the Mountain](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Heart_of_the_Mountain), to complete the chapter. After getting past all of the chapter's obstacles, the player can complete the level and simultaneously be awarded the Crystal Heart (entitled _Heart of the mountain_).

**Crystal Hearts** are high-importance collectables in _Celeste_. Their primary purpose is to unlock different chapters locked by [Heart Doors](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Heart_Door); thus, they are also a prerequisite to unlocking all [C-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/C-Sides), [Variant Mode](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Variant_Mode), and [Golden Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Strawberries). They also serve as chapter completion objectives for all B-Sides, all C-Sides, and [Core A-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#A-Side). Blue Crystal Hearts appear in every A-Side, Red Crystal Hearts in every B-Side, Gold Crystal Hearts in every C-Side, and a Gray Crystal Heart in [Farewell](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Farewell), which is revealed to be fake and has cracks. Each Crystal Heart, except the C-Side ones, also has a name specific to itself and an associated [achievement](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Achievements) with said name.

A Crystal Heart can be collected by dashing into it. In [5B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/5B), a crystal heart can also be gathered by throwing a [Theo Crystal](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo_Crystal) into it.

After a heart is collected, Madeline slows down, and the game continues to run for 135 frames (~2.25 seconds) before she completely stops. It is possible to die during these 135 frames if, for instance, Madeline dashes into spikes. After the collection cutscene depicting the heart in the middle of the screen, the heart is saved and will remain in the save file indefinitely.

## A-Side Crystal Hearts\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?action=edit&section=1)\]

Crystal Hearts in A-Sides serve as well-guarded secrets, often hiding at quite a significant distance from the main path or requiring otherwise tedious tasks to be performed. These Crystal Hearts are blue, and each one has a unique name and achievement associated with it.

An exception to this rule is [Core A-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#A-Side): there, it acts the same way as a B-Side or a C-Side heart, being located at the end of the level, and collecting it ends the level. Such hearts also exist within various Celeste [custom maps](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Maps).

[A guide](https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2027298456) is available for anyone struggling with locating the Crystal Hearts. It contains a lot of hints and pointers before giving out the solution, so try it out!

## B-Side and C-Side Crystal Hearts\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?action=edit&section=2)\]

Crystal Hearts appear at the end of a [Cassette Block](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Block) room in every [B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/B-Side) in _Celeste_. These Crystal Hearts are red, and each of them also has a unique name and achievement associated with it.

Every [C-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/C-Side) also contains a Crystal Heart at its end. Unlike the B-Side crystal hearts, these often aren't located at safe locations, and Madeline can die while collecting them. These Crystal Hearts are gold in color, and unlike A and B-Side Crystal hearts, they do not have an associated name or achievement. They also do not appear in the [journal](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Journal).

All B-Side and C-Side Crystal Hearts double as [golden strawberry](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_strawberry) collection triggers. The "1000" that appears when a strawberry is collected appears when the heart cutscene plays and remains on screen until the "spinning heart" animation is skipped.

## Trivia\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?action=edit&section=3)\]

- In early development, only one large heart was meant to exist in the game, and the collectables in each chapter would have been heart shards that would potentially unlock Core. It was changed to what it is now in the release version.[\[1\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart#cite_note-1)
- Every heart color plays a slightly different pitch of the collection sound.
- Golden strawberries are saved immediately after dashing into a Crystal Heart in chapters that end with them. Dying after collecting a heart will save the golden strawberry and will respawn the player at the nearest checkpoint instead of at the beginning of the level.
- The heart names were initially meant to be an experiment with a poem that could have possibly been reassembled in the [journal](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Journal), but the idea was never fulfilled, and realigning the hearts is purely cosmetic.[\[2\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart#cite_note-2)
 - Most of the current heart names are the same as the names of one of the tracks in the chapter in A- and B-Sides. Namely, the track that the B-Side remixes is the track the A-Side heart is named after, and the B-Side heart is named after the mix's name. The only exceptions to this are 1A, 4A and 7A.

**Celestial Resort** is the third chapter of [Celeste](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste). Preceded by [Old Site](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site) and succeeded by [Golden Ridge](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge), it occurs in the decrepit Celestial Resort Hotel. It introduces [Mr. Oshiro](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mr._Oshiro), a ghost who manages the hotel and tries convincing Madeline to stay. This chapter notably features a vast number of [Dust Bunnies](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Dust_Bunnies), which are the products of Mr. Oshiro's insecurities. They serve as the chapter's main obstacles, although [spikes](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Spikes) still appear.

| After leaving the ruins, [Madeline](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Madeline) arrives at a hotel. There, she finds and rings a bell with a note saying "Please Ring for Service". The lights go down and a ghost appears, introducing himself as the concierge of the "world-renowned Celestial Resort Hotel", [Mr. Oshiro](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mr._Oshiro). He asks Madeline for the length of her stay, to which she replies that she wants to leave and continue climbing the mountain. This makes Oshiro a bit concerned about losing a guest, so he tells Madeline that there is a world-class view of the peak in their presidential suite and offers to guide her to the room. After traversing a few rooms, Madeline tells him that the hotel is in pretty rough shape. Soon after, Madeline finds herself in a messy room full of clothes, books, and crates. Oshiro starts getting worried, realizing the hotel is a huge mess. After realizing he can't clean the whole resort alone, he gives up, but Madeline helps him. When Madeline starts cleaning, Oshiro thinks it's the power of positive thinking; however, Madeline tells him that it was her who cleaned some of the clutter. Eventually, Madeline can find a paper hidden under a pile of clothes, informing the hotel staff that the Celestial Resort is closing; this explains part of why the hotel is in such shape. She can also find [Theo](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo) crawling through the vents to escape the hotel, telling her to stop helping Oshiro; this fails to work, and Madeline continues cleaning. If Madeline has never seen or talked to Theo before, she will introduce herself first; if she has ignored him despite having seen him in either [Forsaken City](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City) or [Old Site](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site), she will additionally apologize for being antisocial. After cleaning up all the mess, Oshiro guides her to the presidential suite, where, en route, she again finds Theo telling her to leave. A bit later, she encounters Oshiro leaking [dust bunnies](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Dust_bunnies) out of his head due to nervousness, blocking the shortcut. This explains where all of the dust bunnies came from. Upon Madeline reaching the suite, she tells Oshiro that it is beautiful solely to avoid disappointing him (he doesn't realize this). Maddy then again states her intent, that she wants to leave to continue climbing the mountain. Oshiro's nervousness continues to manifest and makes it so that he'll give Madeline a discount. She declines, stating that she wishes to continue climbing the mountain. Oshiro begs her to stay in the hotel but is quickly interrupted by [Badeline](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Badeline), who appears in the mirror and then proceeds to shatter it, telling Oshiro that he is a loser and that the hotel is the worst place she's ever seen. Madeline attempts to calm down Oshiro, who soon enough ends up snapping and lashing out at her. Badeline tries to convince Maddy that she shouldn't be helping the creepy weirdo that Oshiro is. > “This resort is a dump. No one would ever want to stay here.” > > ~ Badeline, talking to Oshiro Soon after, Oshiro starts attacking Madeline while she tries to escape the hotel on the rooftop. After a long chase sequence, Oshiro breaks the roof and makes Madeline fall onto the ground with him; he subsequently explains that he knows the hotel is a total mess and was supposed to be closed for repairs and asks her to leave him alone. |

Celestial Resort's **A-Side** is the first "indoors" chapter in _Celeste_, and marks a notably increased level of difficulty compared to Forsaken City and Old Site. It introduces new entities to the game, most notably keys and locks, as well as omnipresent [dust bunnies](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Dust_bunnies). The chapter is also much longer than Old Site.

#### Start\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=4) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=4)\]

The chapter begins outside the resort. It features static and moving [dust bunnies](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Dust_bunnies). Madeline needs to collect a key to access the resort. More locks, which need to be unlocked, are present throughout the chapter.

After making it to the hotel, Madeline needs to interact with the bell, triggering a cutscene and unlocking the path forward. Madeline then needs to navigate some more through the cluttered and dust-bunnies-filled hotel.

#### Huge Mess\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=5) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=5)\]

The second subchapter has three paths that can be taken in any order. At the end of each is a Clutter switch, which, when dashed into, removes certain clutter from all rooms in the hotel. This makes taking subsequent paths slightly harder but also eases navigating the main room. The top path removes the books, the middle one removes the clothes, and the bottom one removes the crates.

The available paths are initially locked. Madeline needs to interact with Mr. Oshiro to unlock them. This interaction needs to be repeated for every path.

[Theo](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo), who tries to escape from the hotel via the vent, can be found in the middle path. The interaction with him is **mandatory** this time.

After all clutter is cleaned up, Madeline can access a key that opens the door to the elevator shaft.

#### Elevator Shaft\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=6) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=6)\]

The subchapter begins with a vertical elevator shaft. Madeline must use walljumps to climb it, avoiding dust bunnies that move up and down along the path.

Optionally at the top of the elevator shaft the player may speak with Theo from the vent before continuing.

After a few more rooms, Mr. Oshiro can be found. He spews dust bunnies over the path, which block Madeline's path forward, forcing her to take a detour below. However, it is possible to [demodash](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Demodash) through this barrier.

#### Presidential Suite\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=7) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=7)\]

The Presidential Suite subchapter starts with a cutscene, after which Madeline needs to climb on the roof. There, Oshiro starts attacking Madeline, forcing her to avoid him; you can jump on him to gain height and refill a dash. The subchapter takes part primarily outdoors and features Dust Bunnies as well.

### B-Side\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=8) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=8)\]

Like the A-Side, Celestial Resort's B-Side is a considerable step up in difficulty from the previous two chapters ― it has the same mechanics as its A-Side counterpart, but it has far more dust bunnies and less safe ground to land on. Unlike the A-Side, Madeline doesn't need to search for clutter switches to clean up the resort. The segment where Mr. Oshiro chases Madeline on the rooftop is much more precise, but he doesn't appear in the cassette room. Its music is notable for being, along with [Golden Ridge's B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge#B-Side), one of the only B-Side songs in Celeste that's an original composition.

### C-Side\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=9) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=9)\]

Celestial Resort's C-Side contains three rooms. The first one is a short chamber with fast vertically-moving dust bunnies that need to be avoided. The second requires walljumps to complete, and the third long room reintroduces Oshiro as a boss. It is required to jump on him later in the room.

## Collectables\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=10) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=10)\]

Main article: [Celestial Resort Collectables](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort/Collectables)

Celestial Resort contains 25 red strawberries hidden throughout the chapter. This includes two winged strawberries, and no seeded berries are present. Additionally, a [Cassette Tape](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape) and a Blue [Crystal Heart](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart) are hidden within.

## Speedrun strategies\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=11) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=11)\]

### Faster Key Grab\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=12) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=12)\]

Instead of taking the standard route to grab the key at the beginning of the chapter, speedrunners take advantage of the screen transitions refilling the dash to grab the key by simply dashing through the screen transition multiple times. This is also how you obtain the [Crystal Heart](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart) in Old Site and the second strawberry in this chapter.

### Elevator Shaft demodash\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=13) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=13)\]

Following the cutscene where Oshiro starts spewing out [dust bunnies](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Dust_bunnies), it is possible to [demodash](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Demodash) to skip having to take a detour below. This is commonly used in any% speedruns since it can save approximately twelve seconds over the intended method.

## Celeste Classic\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?veaction=edit&section=14) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort?action=edit&section=14)\]

Main article: [Celeste Classic](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste_Classic)

A computer hidden in the "Huge Mess" subchapter of Chapter 3 contains the [PICO-8 version of Celeste](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste_Classic), originally released in 2016. Interacting with the computer will unlock the option to play the PICO-8 version straight from the main menu.

# Chapter 3- Celestial Resort

Chapter 3 is where Celeste ramps up. Both the difficulty and length of the level trump its predecessors. This haunted hotel is slammed with secrets and dangers that will put your mountain climbing skills to the test. Let’s check in and go exploring!

Play

Below is a list of all 25 strawberries for this level, as well as the locations for the cassette tape and the Blue Heart. There is also a collectible easter egg in this chapter.

### Strawberry \#1

The first strawberry of the chapter is out in the open, along with a new type of enemy. The spooky black matter that go up and down will haunt you for the entire chapter. Use the spring in between them to position yourself to grab the strawberry near the bottom of the screen. Climb back up and jump to the spring to be able to use it to get to safe ground above.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/5c/180125_CI_C3_S1.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#2

After encountering the black matter for the first time, hop onto the roof above them. This little path leads you to spot this strawberry, which is in a tricky spot. The key is to go over one more screen to the left. Using the raised platform there, jump and dash diagonally to the right.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/04/180125_CI_C3_S2_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

When transitioning screens, your dash is restored. Grab the edge of the spikes and then jump up and dash to the platform above the strawberry. Drop down and dash left to avoid the spikes while successfully grabbing the fruit.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/b/bc/180125_CI_C3_S2_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#3

After meeting Mr. Oshiro, follow him into the next room. Half way through the room, you can spot the strawberry floating by a window. Jump down and then dash back up to the next platform to secure the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/a5/180125_CI_C3_S3.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#4

When in the room with the key, head to the left instead of working your way around to the objective. In this next room you can walk the path below to scout out the next couple of rooms. In the first room, use the spring to grab the first block in the series of three. They will fall once grabbed onto, so jump to the second and then the third until you can dash to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/65/180125_CI_C3_S4_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

You can see the strawberry on the left side of the room. Use the disappearing blocks to jump to the strawberry and grab the wall. Slide down to avoid the moving matter and then jump up above the disappearing platform. It should return as you fall downward. Quickly move and hop back to safety. Don’t leave until you go through the secret passage on the top of the screen!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/fd/180125_CI_C3_S4_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#5

When in the room with the key, head to the left instead of working your way around to the objective. In this next room you can walk the path below to scout out the next couple of rooms. In the first room, use the spring to grab the first block in the series of three. They will fall once grabbed onto, so jump to the second and then the third until you can dash to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/fd/180125_CI_C3_S4_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

This is the room for Strawberry #4, but there is a secret passage in the ceiling. Dash through the indented space to find new rooms. You’ll need to dash through the tight space and grab the wall on the other side. Renew your dash and stamina with the green crystal. Using the lantern as a marker, jump up and dash past the black matter to grab the wall. Jump to the adjacent wall, slide down, and hop to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/f1/180125_CI_C3_S5_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Use the green crystals in this room to dash your way across without touching the black matter. The little path on the left leads outside to the strawberry. You can use the disappearing blocks back in the room to access the lower path and walk safely back to the key room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/b/b2/180125_CI_C3_S5_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/2f/180125_CI_C3_S5_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#6

Crossing the room beyond the locked door, you can see a path upward above Mr. Oshiro. Using the right-hand side of the rightmost platform you can jump off and dash up into the passage. This leads to a room with the strawberry. Use the green crystals to navigate the room and snag the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/23/180125_CI_C3_S6_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/9/91/180125_CI_C3_S6_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#7

After following Mr. Oshiro, you can spot this strawberry flying on the edge of the screen. Use the platforms to cross the room without dashing so you can grab the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/ad/180125_CI_C3_S7.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#8

This strawberry is along the path to get the next key you need. You can see it in the room with the spinning orbs of black matter and the lowering platforms. You need to land on the second platform then drop down to the strawberry and the adjacent left wall. When the space above you is clear, dash to the third platform and then jump to the left wall to climb out of the room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/f1/180125_CI_C3_S8.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#9

There is a secret path in the room above Strawberry #8. Use the wall of towels to climb your way up to the lip in the left corner.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/50/180125_CI_C3_S9_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

This hidden room is a sort of "U" shape of platforming. Dropping down on the right-hand side, use your dashes to avoid the black matter. At the bottom of the "U" is the strawberry. Climb up the left side to get out. Use the disappearing platform to jump to the left wall and climb up to the next disappearing platform. Jump to the wall on the right to be higher then the final platform. Jump from there and dash upward to escape.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/11/180125_CI_C3_S9_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#10

You’ll notice this strawberry at the top of the screen in the room with the thin columns with spikes on the top and matter creating surfaces on their sides. Jump and grab the left side of the first column. Jump off of this column and dash to the right side of the second, completely ignoring the middle area. You will use those walls to safely get the strawberry back.

Jump and grab the top side of the floating column, leaving the bottom half clear for later. Jump to the opposite side and then leap to the adjacent column. From there you may grab the edge of the platform beneath the strawberry, jump up and dash to the left to snag the fruit. When falling, grab one of the walls you left open to safely make it back to the ground.

This cashes in the strawberry. Hopefully you left enough of the floating column’s surface clear to advance. You may also try jumping and dashing immediately to the second floating column. If you die, that’s okay! Even it you die now, the strawberry is locked in.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/3/36/180125_CI_C3_S10.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#11

After the room with the floating columns, smash the floor in the left corner. This takes you to the strawberry you saw earlier that was above the key. You need to jump between the two chunks of black matter to grab the strawberry and safely return to the other side.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/e5/180125_CI_C3_S11_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/c8/180125_CI_C3_S11_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

# Huge Mess

This portion of the chapter can be divided into three sections. You help Mr. Oshiro by cleaning up the hotel. This involves putting away the three types of clutter, which conveniently, is divided into three separate rooms. The library books are in the upper right corner, the towels in the right middle, and the boxes in the lower right corner. Each room will be separated below.

## Library Books

### Strawberry \#12

Just after the room with the blue heart (which is found in the towel section) you can spot this strawberry hanging precariously low over some black matter. This strawberry revolves around timing. You can walk and drop down to it and then dash to one of the two walls. Wall jump and climb your way to the top while avoiding the moving matter.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/ec/180125_CI_C3_S12.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#13

This strawberry can be seen in the room on the lower right near a floating column and a green crystal. If you have not cleaned up the boxes yet, this strawberry is easier to snag.

Slide down the wall and leap off of it, dashing as you do so, to soar over the floating column to the strawberry. Grab the column’s right wall, climb up and leap over the top to land of the left side. Line up with the green crystal, waiting if you hit it on the way over, then dash off the wall to the left. Use the second dash to safely grab on to the wall. Jump up and renew your stamina and dash with the second crystal. Jump and dash over the black matter to weave your way down to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/7/7b/180125_CI_C3_S13.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#14

Before advancing to the next room, make your way back to the bridge of objects you walked across to enter this large room. With the books out of the way, you may now drop below to grab a hidden strawberry below.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/3/39/180125_CI_C3_S14_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/e2/180125_CI_C3_S14_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Towels

### Strawberry \#15

Two rooms after talking with Theo, you can spot this flying strawberry hiding in the lower right corner under the flow of water. Hop your way across the room without dashing, until the final column. You need to dash to lure the flying strawberry out of the water and up toward you. Jump off the wall to snag it midair and land safely on the ground below.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/cd/180125_CI_C3_S15.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#16

This strawberry is in the room with two tall columns of towels and a space in between them. The strawberry is beneath the flow of water in the middle. When at the top of the first purple column, drop down and pass the center block. Dash through the water to grab the strawberry and climb up the left towel column. Hop onto the center block to renew your stamina and dash. Hop over the second towel column and drop safely to the ground while avoiding the flying matter.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/4c/180125_CI_C3_S16.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Blue Heart

You may have seen the Blue Heart beneath the floor while in the library book section. After cleaning up the towels by smashing the big magical button, do not climb out of the room on the left. Instead, dash up through the water on the right.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/01/180125_CI_C3_BH_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

You now have to platform back to the room where you spoke to Theo. Once back in the room, dash into the upper left corner to find the path to the blue heart. Dash into it to collect!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/ee/180125_CI_C3_BH_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/d8/180125_CI_C3_BH_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Pico-8 Easter Egg

Play

After exiting the towel area, you can access a small laundry area through a entry way in the main room. This room is in the right middle as well, slightly above the lower right entry to the box area. There is a small note about the hotel in the laundry. In the upper area is a small path that leads to a computer room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/cc/180125_CI_C3_P_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

The computer is a Pico-8 which is game development software, similar in limitation to the Gameboy. On it you can play the original Celeste! Play as much as you want now. When you wrap up, it will be permanently playable from the main menu. Beat it for an achievement/trophy!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/00/180125_CI_C3_P_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Boxes

### Strawberry \#17

The room after using the switch to open a pathway is a tight corridor area. The tight space makes for precision platforming. In the lower right corner, in the path of some flying black matter, is a pathway to a strawberry room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/8/81/180125_CI_C3_S17_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

In the strawberry room, you have to treat the walls like a game of "the floor is lava." On the first column, stick to the left half. Dash upward and climb onto the floating square. Drop down and dash to the right. Climb the right wall, then jump to get the strawberry. When falling down, dash to the left onto the safe square on the ground. Climb the right side of the first column and then jump to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/a7/180125_CI_C3_S17_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#18 (Not the 18th)

On your way up to the button you will see this strawberry on the left. Dash up between the matter to the top of the column, saving half the floor for a safe return. Drop to the ground, again saving some space for the return journey. Dash diagonally into the left wall, above the moving matter. Wall jump to the right and grab the strawberry. Maneuver your way down to ground platform, using the safe spaces you left yourself. Climb out of the area to secure the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/4f/180125_CI_C3_S18.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Elevator Shaft

### Strawberry \#19

After the room with the four switches, you’ll enter a long, perilous stretch of room. The strawberry is at the to middle. To nab it requires hopping over parts of the floor to leave a safe area for the journey back.

Dash over the diagonal matter and land in the center of the bottom floor. From here, jump in between the trash can and bookcase. Now jump out and dash straight up to land of the rightmost portion of the first self platform, leaving the left for later. Do the same for the shelf above, grabbing the left edge of it to make sure you can make the jump. Now dash to the right to get the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/d5/180125_CI_C3_S19_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Land below on the right half of the bottom floor, which should be clear. Hop into the holes you made before all the way to the edge. Jump up to the shelves, using the clear areas on the left. Once on the top shelf, jump out and dash to the left to hit the green crystal. Weave through the matter and dash to the safe ground. Grab the left wall, jump off and dash up to grab the right wall. Then jump to the top left corner for safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/13/180125_CI_C3_S19_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#20

This strawberry is in the room with the locked door on the left. The strawberry itself is in the lower right corner. You need to drop down to the floor and dodge the moving matter. Get to the right edge, while saving some floor for the return, and dash up in between to two orbs. Grab the wall and jump to the adjacent wall to snag the floating strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/4b/180125_CI_C3_S20_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Drop down and move to grab the right wall. Then when the path is clear, jump back to the floor. Climb the column in the center and drop to the left side for safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/1c/180125_CI_C3_S20_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#21

The room to the left of the locked door has a small gap in the floor right by the entrance. Drop down inside to find two strawberries. For the strawberry on the right, climb the right wall and dash upward when the coast is clear. Hitting the crystal on the way, grab the rightmost wall and slide down. Dash to the left to grab the strawberry. Climb up the wall and jump over when the orbs of matter are out of the way. Fall to the floor to secure the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/fa/180125_CI_C3_S21.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#22

The room to the left of the locked door has a small gap in the floor right by the entrance. Drop down inside to find two strawberries. For the strawberry on the left, dash up through the black matter and fall to the ground. Save some space for the return. Climb up the left wall, avoiding the orb, and grab the strawberry. Slide down the left wall and hop back to the safe ground you left. Climb the wall and dash up when it is clear and fall to the ground for safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/1a/180125_CI_C3_S22.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Cassette Tape

After grabbing the key, enter the glowing room to the left. This is the cassette room. The blue and pink platforms alternate based off the beat of the music. Time your jumps to navigate the room on the alternating platforms to grab the tape. This unlocks Chapter 3’s B Side level.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/16/180125_CI_C3_CT.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Presidential Suite

These strawberries must be collected during the boss chase with Mr. Oshiro!

### Strawberry \#23

When you first come across switches in the chase, you’ll be near the strawberry. When grabbing the second switch, you need to bounce off of Mr. Oshiro’s head in order to get enough height to clear the black matter and grab the floating strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/af/180125_CI_C3_S23.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#24

This strawberry is easy to spot. During the chase, you see a small structure that you have to go through. The strawberry is at the top. Climb the left wall and jump through the gap to grab the strawberry and land on the other side.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/d4/180125_CI_C3_S24.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#25

The final strawberry for chapter 3 is at the tail end of the chase. You’ll see it hanging low over some black matter. Drop down and dash to the right to snag it and grab the wall. Climb up to secure it!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/4f/180125_CI_C3_S25.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)
